Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service....property could use a makeover”
Reviews.Author: R C
Reviews.Content: Lisa A was such a sweetheart while checking me in. Shes very engaging and does her best to ensure that you're a happy guest. The room was clean and decent size for a standard room. Overall happy with my stay..Cheers Lisa A!!!!:)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, super great price”
Reviews.Author: Iamashbash
Reviews.Content: We were delighted at check in by Lisa Adams who gave us great recommendations on what to do during our stay. On top of that she upgraded our stay to include parking and club level access. I would definitely recommend the Sheraton, the bathrooms and rooms are updated and the service is stellar.

Reviews.Title: “Need to remodel; Noisy but nice staff”
Reviews.Author: DrAlias
Reviews.Content: Let me get to the point. I stayed on the 20th floor and heard everything that was going on outside (cars, motorcycles, buses and people talking). They definitely need new windows, it was ridiculous!! I could not sleep. It is obvious that this is a old hotel and could use some remodeling in the bathrooms and rooms. The food is over priced in the restaurant and the gift shop staff was horrible. I went in to purchase souvineirs and the cashier was playing a battleship game on his phone the entire time, not once did he look up or ask if I needed assistance. The customers inside all looked at each other and we shaked our heads and we all walked out without purchasing anything. The elevators are slow and the housekeepers uses the same elevators, which limited the guest during our conference and stay. I would not recommend this hotel at all unless you are low on cash and desperate!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: candii00
Reviews.Content: So far, I've had a wonderful experience at this hotel. My room is average/large in size. It's clean, well stocked, and maintained. However, a satisfactory room won't ensure my repeat business. I like to try out different hotels. So, to ensure my return, service is paramount. Lisa Adams, in particular, has offered me fast, efficient, hiccup-free, and friendly service. She could be a hospitality trainer. I do a lot of both business and leisure travel and, honestly, this has been the best check-in and follow-up service that I've received in years. So, yes, I will recommend this hotel to friends & will be staying here next time I'm in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “kudos for front desk”
Reviews.Author: jalpher
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting at the hotel, didn't stay there, but the front desk was, particularly Lisa A., was very helpful to me

Reviews.Title: “Inconsiderate employees.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWorld8642
Reviews.Content: Some worker came into our room at 7 O'clock in the monring without knocking when my family and i were all sleeping. Also, they started vaccuming our hallway at 9 O'clock am! Not to mention that we checked in at 1 O'clock am

Reviews.Title: “Getting pretty tired...”
Reviews.Author: BrianAtTheBeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business last week. Let's cut to the quick. The reason I gave the low rating is because of peeling paint on the walls. Not good. The other thing is that it is noisy. Diagonally across the street is a large entertainmen venue. The Ringling Bros. circus was going on. I could actually hear the ringmaster's voice from across the street inside another building in my room on the 4th floor! The street traffic noise was rough. I realize the hotel can't control the amount of noise, but they can control how much of it gets into rooms. The appearance of the meeting rooms were average, at best. Now for the high points. The staff at the hotel were great. Absolutely no complaints there. But it wasn't until I got home that I realized my bill was screwed up. I called and I'm still waiting to make sure it got straightened out on my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED, RUN DOWN, AND DISORGANIZED!”
Reviews.Author: VBMOM3215
Reviews.Content: Don't book here as I am sure you can find a better hotel in downtown Baltimore. Check in was a mess as we had four women in our group they told us all they had was a room with a king bed. The staff was rude and basically told us this is all they have. We stood our ground and they finally got us a room with two double beds. We had also earlier in the week, prior to our arrival, asked a refrigerator for our room and they said no problem. Well we stayed there four days and everyday we would call requesting the refrigerator and they would say "no problem we will send one right up," but it never arrived! Our room was in the north tower on the 19th floor. The bathroom was small and dated. When you took a shower (and yes the shower curtain was inside the tub) there would appear water on the carpet outside of the bathroom. You could hear everything going on outside from people screaming and yelling to police in the street on their speakers. This happened almost nightly! Our room was also a sauna. It was so hot and we had to call maintenance up twice to fix the thermostat. The first night they fixed it and even changed the air filter that looked like it had not been changed in months. It was filthy! They did set up food for our volleyball team to purchase in the morning on the way out,but it was nothing special...dry bagels..cereal...coffee, etc. The only bright spot of our stay here at this hotel was American Limo service who was available to drive you to the convention center or to local area restaraunts at a very very reasonable price. The vehicles were clean and the drivers courteous and friendly. I would recommend using their service and not walking alone at night. By the time you paid for the room, tax, and daily parking the price we paid for this hotel was way to high for what we received! Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: YBtravel
Reviews.Content: I checked in at a busy time. The check in was four lanes, 20 people deep. At every Starwood hotel there is a separate Gold and Platinum check in line. They did not have one that day and stated it was because they where busy. That line is a perk for loyalty. It is not a benefit when there are only two people in line. It's a benefit when there is a long line. The lobby was a mess. Glasses and beer bottles every where. Even if the hotel is busy and over run, there should have been staff circling to clean up consistently. The staff was matter of fact, not necessarily friendly. I finally got to the desk to check in at 7 pm only to be told it would be another hour before I could have a room. Unacceptable at that late hour and I had a baby than needed to sleep. There was no free water or internet like in other Starwood Hotels. Rooms becoming shabby. Hotel was noisy until about 11 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Worn down hotel does not live up to brand name”
Reviews.Author: Richmond-VA-Barb
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were worn and in general the feel of the hotel was just tired. AC did not work in room and area is not the best to be in at night. I would recommend staying at another SPG hotel and pay more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tymchugh
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on priceline for 2 night stay on St Patrick's Day weekend. My wife's sister from Brazil was visiting with us for the month and we decided to go to Baltimore for a fun weekend out. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. When we checked in, they had us set up for a King bed. As tempting as that was, I asked if they had a room available with 2 beds. The guy at the front desk (I forget his name, sorry) upgraded us to a corner deluxe room, which was very spacious with two beds and lots of windows. The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 out of 5 is because of the steep parking fee ($22 a day), which is normal for downtown in any city, and also you could hear a lot of noise coming from the street at night. Not located in the nicest part of town either, but still close to the harbor and power plant live, which is what we came for. All things considered, it was a great stay and I would hope to get this hotel again if bidding the Baltimore Inner Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding housekeeping, understaffed hotel”
Reviews.Author: pilar m
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two weeks at the Sheraton for business and though we had a lovely room and extremely friendly associates, we found that we had to ask several times for things to get done and concluded that the hotel was understaffed. However, we had the most wonderful housekeeper I've ever had in all my business travels. Tami Oglesby went out of her way to make sure we had what we needed, was always friendly and accomadating, and truly went above and beyond what her duties were to make our stay comfortable. Thank you to her a million times.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever!”
Reviews.Author: FFXTravelers
Reviews.Content: This was the worst travel experience we've had!! There were definate signs of drug usage throughout the building. The staff was nice but thats the only decent part of the hotel, we had to move room in the wee hours of the night bc the guests next to us were smoking pot in their rooms, this hotel brings out the worst of baltimore. The city in general is a normal urban enviornment but they hotel seems to house the "worst" of locals. My Husband and I after drug related experiences (we had other encounters besides the pot smoking) wanted to just leave but since it was 3am it did not seem logical to drive multiple hours to get home. The staff was nice but , they did not comp our stay or even offer to pay the $35 valet service. WILL NOT STAY AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MsTravel27
Reviews.Content: As other guests have noted, the front desk staff, Santia and the other ladies are AWESOME! Hotels.com screwed up my reservation; however, the front desk worked with me and got me a very good rate. Everyone is very friendly there. As far as rooms, I was on the 17th floor and had no issues with my room. I like the finishes of nickel in the bathroom and did not have any problems with my room being unclean. I'm thankful I did not have any issue with bedbugs as some have mentioned; however, people need to realize that bedbugs travel and sometimes they are on your clothes and you do not realize that you are a carrier, just saying. Cable channels were okay, I do not know of any hotel and I have stayed at many that have complete cable channels that you would get at home. Also, why care about t.v. when you are travelling you should be out and about until you are unwinding. I have to pay for movies at home and I have AT&T U-verse, who cares about paying for movies? I like the fact that the hotel is in walking distance to the harbor and there are Zipcars all over the downtown Baltimore area. The only area I would not walk is going toward the Howard Light Rail stop which is not the most pleasant area; however, you can not take what lurks around the hotel out on the hotel itself. Come downtown Chicago on Michigan Avenue and you will still find homeless people walking by and trying to stay in the area. It's called move on folks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: rjeffery1
Reviews.Content: Great location for the $$$. I booked on Priceline and got a great deal. The only complaints that I have was the internet service would go in and out, and the ice machine was out of ice. I called and asked to have ice brought up to my room and never received it. I also called and asked for clean towels, and never received them either. Aside from this, which in my mind was very petty, I really enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Charge for everyhing”
Reviews.Author: Nikkig2011
Reviews.Content: $35.00 a day for Valet parking. $25.00 a day for self parking but good luck finding a space. $10.00 for Wi-Fi. $13.00 for a continental breakfast. There are no refrigerators in the rooms. No movie channels no Lifetime, USA or Bravo you have to pay to watch movies.

Reviews.Title: “worn out”
Reviews.Author: kaykow
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in a bad part of town. Rooms are shabby. Carpeting in room and hallways are lumpy and need to be replaced. The only good thing about this hotel was the staff. The front desk staff, valet and door men was friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: pbrfan13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very shabby. The carpeting in our room and in the hallways had lumps in it. Bathroom was very tiny. It was difficult to reach the handle to flush the toilet. Room was drafty. Housekeeping did not do a good job of vacuuming. Due to a large flea market, it was difficult to reach the elevators. The hotel is located in a run down part of downtown Baltimore. I read other reviews and was hesitant to stay here. We only stayed here because the PBR bull riders were staying at this hotel. The front desk staff, bell man and the valets were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is the only highlight....”
Reviews.Author: Amy E
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel with a lot of trepidation after reading the reviews but the athletes for the event I was attending were staying there and I wanted to believe that the reviews were wrong. The staff was wonderful. Santia at the front desk was the best. So friendly and welcoming. She remembered me the next day and helped me with directions. But my room was another story. A cell phone placed on the table between the beds STUCK because of some sticky substance on it. The desk area was also very sticky. The comment card placed there by the hotel was fully adhered to the desk in some kind of sticky substance. The next day, after housekeeping was done, the sticky substances were still there. Nasty! The room simply was not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Conference weekend.”
Reviews.Author: MiSusan
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Front desk very helpful. Lobby was grungy. Need key for lavatory on lobby level. Had to get staff to open it for me following check out and it was dirty. Bell man steered me toward unlicensed jitney when my super shuttle no showed even though there was a real taxi right there. I did not realize until too late that I was not with licensed cab. As a woman traveling solo I was afraid and angry and will report this.

Reviews.Title: “Two-month stay, no Starwood points, traumatized by bedbugs and gunshots.”
Reviews.Author: Ronald R
Reviews.Content: My company selected this hotel and paid for a two-month stay for over 150 people to reside in the rooms, and also purchased numerous conference rooms for daily classes. Can you say $$$$$$? To begin - if I selected this hotel on my own, I would have abandoned my stinky room in the middle of the night. My pillows had blood on them from the bedbugs, and I am personally traumatized from the bites and unexplained bleeding and bumps I left there with. This hotel is outdated, and between the two towers (and who knows how many rooms), there are only 3 washers (2 working) and 3 dryers. While I was there, I had to wash clothes between 2:00 and 4:00am in order to find an available washer/dryer in the laundry room. My company had numerous problems, all of which received a response that was only geared towards keeping our organization from voiding their contract with this place. Was it terrible staying here? YES, and it was an endurance test. Sometimes the rooms didn’t get cleaned. The conference rooms were hot, poorly lit, and ventilated with the stench of this old dilapidated building’s basement smells. The public bathrooms were rarely cleaned and smelled like pure p$%&. We endured this and more, and received no points for it? We should have received points, free gifts, an apology, a back rub, and FREE BED BUG CREAM!!! Upon arriving, we were told that we would receive Starwood points for our stay if we could provide a Starwood membership number. Later, we were told, "Since your company paid for the room in your name, points cannot be granted." OK, other hotels in the area that housed employees from my organization provided points, so why not Starwood? Personally, I believe this is their way of saying, "don't stay here next time!" No problem! I would like to ask that anyone belonging to my organization (you know who you are) please let the folks who decide to pay substandard hotels such as this, such astronomical $$$$ to simply STOP!!! More specifically, DO NOT SEND ANOTHER LARGE GROUP TO THIS HOTEL!!! By the way, I Will not rest until someone hears me on this one!!! I already contacted the national office for SPG, but to no avail. I was told that the hotel must deal with this situation. Well Sheraton Baltimore City Center...…..DEAL WITH IT!!! P.S. Shula’s is outdated, and the food/service is mediocre at best. The sound of sirens is so prevalent that I cannot sleep without the sound of them now. This area is not safe, and gunshots will be heard (possible seen) if you stay here long enough. Don't let the valet order you a cab - they will cheat you! Do not take the suggestion to eat at Mo's, it is horrible! That's enough for now, I'm certain that the General Manger of the hotel will NOT respond to me since I am complimenting his hotel. So what!! The truth is the truth!!! If you think I am "HOT", wait until you here from my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “The Bellmen were the best part of the stay!”
Reviews.Author: heyblondie005
Reviews.Content: GIRL'S WEEEND!! We checked in the Friday before the big game (Ravens). We were denied an upgrade because, according to the man at the front desk "the hotel is booked solid and there aren't any available". Later, we asked about the continental breakfast on the club level and were told "it's closed because we aren't busy enough to have it open". HUH?? The Bellman Darien (??) gave us an excellent recommendation for dinner, Luna del Sea. He called for a complimentary car to bring us there and back. The food was excellent! Upon our return, Darien was waiting in the lobby with kind words and a complimentary bottled water for each of us. The daytime bellman, I didn't get his name, was just as helpful and kind. We never once opened a door and never entered or left the hotel without a friendly greeting. I can not say as much for the front desk. Truly lacking in the customer service department. Maybe they can get some pointers from the bellmen! Our only disappointment was Shulas restaurant. We stopped in for a drink on Saturday night and asked the waiter what they had to offer as far as "hot coffee drinks". He flipped open the menu and said "we have this extensive list of martinis". I said "we want coffee drinks please". It was all down hill from there. He gave us our tiny cups of coffee, one with Kahlua and one with Irish whiskey. We drank them. He didn't come back until we were done. He said "are you ladies all set"? We said yes, he slammed the check on the table.....$23.98.....and we left the cash in the folder....$24.00.....and left. He was grouchy, miserable and not at ALL an asset to Shulas. The prices are outrageous so the least they should do is give GREAT service which he didn't. The hotel room was clean and bright. The noise was awful outside. The neighborhood was sketchy after dark. We had a great time in the city....aquarium, comedy club, dinner on the Inner Harbor.....but probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “NYE stay was just ok”
Reviews.Author: Diana H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on NYE while attending the Baltimore NYE Party Extravaganza. Our stay was ok, the room was clean and comfortable, although rather small. My only complaint would be the bathroom - 1 small sink and not 1 shelf to put your toiletries on. Other than that, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: M N
Reviews.Content: After trying to check in on New Year’s Eve, we realized I had accidently booked my hotel room at a pre-paid rate for the wrong night earlier in the month. The rate that I had booked under was a set rate and the room reservation could not be changed or refunded. The lady at the front desk, Diana Jackson, was extremely helpful. She assured me that we would be taken care of and worked with her manager to fix our reservation without any extra charges. We got a great room, for no extra cost, on one of the busiest nights of the year. The customer service was excellent, and I truly appreciate everything Diana did to make our trip work out. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Believe in it”
Reviews.Author: fatherfor2
Reviews.Content: As the title says, what you see in other reviews, is true. The single pane windows, the noise, the sub-par interior in some places etc etc etc But at the same time the rest of the story holds true, as well. Super friendly staff, that exibits remarkable willingness to go the extra mile and desire to satisfy every request. I'm certain there are better properties in SPG and I'm positive I've stayed at some of them, but I'm also certaint that I have yet to meet such dedicated group of professionals trying to do the best they can, given the circumstances. The take away is simple, give them a chance and you will not be sorry. With enough support they may get their wishes granted - I'm guessing $15M should do the trick :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Free, except the noise!”
Reviews.Author: DrVicProf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way below standard for a Sheraton. First, be prepared to pay for everything!! Parking is valet only at 28.50/day (I was there for 24 hours but they charged me for two days, because “…my car was there past midnight” - no kidding! I was spending the night there! Of course my car would be there past midnight!!!). I complained and they finally took the second night off my final bill. Internet is 12.95 a night for WiFi that not only was unstable, but slow (the connection dropped every five minutes or so making it very frustrating while trying to do just a little bit of work). And then there is the noise! ohhhhh, if you like hearing police sirens all day long and all night long (and they are loud) then this place will be your favorite. Perhaps it's the neighborhood, but the sirens were non-stop. I will say this, the staff was very friendly and pleasant, as if they knew the hotel was a hassle and the least they could do was be nice. My company paid for the stay, so I did really pay for anything, but I will not stay there again. I have been an SPG member for over 8 years and seen dozens of Sheratons around the U.S. – I will not stay here again though. Baltimore has too many better options for business or family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but room for improvement...”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: Arrival: The self parking garage was closed due to the valet part of the garage being renovated, so they were using the self park section as valet...but charging the self parking rate of $24 a night. We valet the first night, then parked across the street for only $15.50 a night. The parking garage across the street is easy to get into, as you approach the Sheraton there is an entrance to the garage in the middle of the street, you can't miss it. Also the garage is very well lit and you need your parking ticket to get into the elevator lobby to retrieve your car. Checking-in: I booked on Priceline, great rate so no complaints there. The front desk employee was nice so I asked for a corner room. She said due to booking on Priceline it would be an extra $30 a night...then when I mentioned I was a Sheraton Preferred Guest Gold member she varified and upgrading us for free and gave us two cookies. The Room: Our room was in the North Tower, room #1010. The room had one, comfortable, king bed, a large desk, flat screen tv, a comfy chair and a good amount of lights. The bathroom was small but workable, the water pressure was not good, when are hotels going to figure out people want good water flow in hotel rooms. The furnishings were all in ok condition. We were however a little surprised that the desk's legs were not attched to the desk and could easily be removed. Another thing why does Sheraton put such large desks in their small rooms. The not so good...the room was cold, even when we turned the heat up to 75 degrees it still felt cold at times. The one-pane windows were most likely the cause of heat loss and also the cause of the noise you could hear from outside. Really one-pane windows, Sheraton wake up. Yes expensive to replace all the windows, but you would save overall by installing new windows and saving on the heating/cooling costs. The windows need to be changed out either way. Overall the room was good enough for a couple nights...but again it needs some renovation. The location: It felt like it was right on the border of a good area and an ok area. Our room faced the "ok" area. There is a bar and restaurant across the street that had interesting activity late at night, people yelling, honking horns and the usual drunken activities. Overall for the price I paid I was ok with the hotel...but most likely wouldn't pay the going hotel website price for this hotel. I think the owners need to do some renovation, starting with the windows...then maybe the going price will be worth it. I will also say the Baltimore Waterfront is one of the nicest I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: SabaiD
Reviews.Content: Needed 3 rooms for family attending an event at the Marina center. Hotel location could not have been better. Staff are pleasant and helpful, but outside of Cairo, this is the saddest Sheraton that I've seen. Tired, threadbare, and scuffed pretty much describes the physical plant.) Most ot the chairs in the lobby/internet area are missing their back cushions; this property must rake it in with meetings/tour groups and sees little need to invest in upkeep. I'm pretty loyal to SPG, but next time I'm in Baltimore I'm staying at the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a one night business trip”
Reviews.Author: kstraveler62
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and staff was gracious and friendly (and they gave me two chocolate chip cookies for being a Starwood Gold Member!). Room (2201 north tower) was clean with good work station, but very small. I stubbed my toe twice trying to get between bed and desk chair. Valet parking was easy (which sounds good considering some of the reviews I read about parking lot). I had a great rate and, as always, a wonderful bed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a concert”
Reviews.Author: karen4352
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton when we attended a concert at 1st Mariner's Arena. It is directly across the street. The rooms were small (we were in 1901 in the North tower) but nice. The bed was comfortable and the staff was nice and helpful. The parking guys even told us of a public parking lot that was much cheaper than parking at the hotel... that is unheard of from hotel valet. Next time we go to Baltimore for a concert, we will surely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Charm City”
Reviews.Author: Georgiaboy62
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in need of some minor maintenance upkeep, but other than that it was ok. THe parking could be a bit better as a first time guest it was confusing. The Starwood Preferred Guest Program worked again to my advantage as I received an upgrade. The room was a nice corner king bed with a GREAT view of the city, large desk and a fridge., THis made my visit all the more worthwhille, Staff was accomdating nd very attentive,they even called me by my name and not just the hotel operator. Made me feel special. A great way to end my trip. Thanks Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down hotel in need of redecoration, but otherwise ok”
Reviews.Author: Do9aN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights during my visit to Baltimore. The location is pretty good, it is centrally located, just few blocks from the harbour. The room was ok, bed was comfortable, but the hotel seemed a bit old, especially the lobby area and halls required urgent redecoration. It is a large hotel, seems like used for conferences. However the restaurant did not match the hotel, with limited food options, and pretty bad breakfast. There is a parking below the hotel for which you need to pay. It is a bit nuisance to take your car out, as their magnetic card never worked, no matter how many times I changed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Not so Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: nyflanctraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice as the room is comfortable and the hotel itself is towards the nice side. I stayed here when I was in town for a baseball game at Camden Yards and it was manageable although the Sheraton Inner Harbor would have been a better choice but more expensive. This hotel is right on the border of a not so nice area and you want to be careful which way you turn when you exit the hotel. They have a Shula's Steakhouse on site which was cool to get a drink after the game but I don't know if I would eat there considering their was a decent size mouse scampering around the restaurant floor. I would definitely stay here again juse beware of your surroundings

Reviews.Title: “terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: burger63
Reviews.Content: I was here for a work meeting and as a frequent Sheraton guest, I was completely disappointed in the accomadations. The service was not good at all and the food was horrible. On top of it all, the fact that they repeatedly stressed not to venture outside the hotel alone, due to the unsafe neighborhood, was a little troublesome. The rooms were clean enough, but the bathrooms were terribly small. There was no counter to the sink, as it was only a pedestal sink. I felt as though I was in a motel. I would never stay here again. The only good thing was that I received my starwoods points.

Reviews.Title: “Convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stfnee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention Oct 27-30th, 2011 but didn't leave the hotel during that time so I cannot comment on the surrounding area. Cons: Parking garage is very creepy. Make sure you don't park on the "green level", or you'll be hiking through the swampy dark garage, up one flight of stairs with your luggage until you get to an elevator to take you up two more levels to the lobby. Room was at the end and on a corner. Did not feel very clean, but there was NO evidence of bedbugs (I comment on this for every hotel review). My white sock feet were dirty from just the rug in my room after walking around without shoes for a couple hours. You will pay for internet on a daily basis. No such thing as Wi-Fi here. There is no where close, quick and convenient to grab food. Hotel restaurant food is ok, great service. PROS; No Bedbugs Pretty good bed, pillows. Clean sheets. Nice lotion, shampoo and conditioner. Clean towels. Hot water Walgreens one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: egellman
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is 3 blocks from the convention center and a 5 minute walk to the Harbor. It is less expensive than some of the inner harbor hotels and just as nice. They have a nice gym, Starwood preferred lounge and very customer oriented. The management was involved and extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than your average Sheraton...”
Reviews.Author: nelsoli
Reviews.Content: Sheraton hotels generally seem to be older and of a lower quality than the rest of Starwood properties, however, this place was even worse than I expected. My room was very standard, with an extremely small bathroom and was very noisy (I could hear everything from the street even though I was on the ninth floor). The air conditioning didn't work - it wouldn't put out cold air, it just chugged and made lots of noise. I ordered room service for dinner which took over 1 hour to be delivered to my room. The only redeeming factor about this hotel was the gym - not only is it free, it had really high-end treadmills. If I ever go back to Baltimore, I will look to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great for leisure travel!”
Reviews.Author: Cisco91
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a side trip to a college reunion in Annapolis. My fiancee has never been to Baltimore, so we took advantage of this hotel's excellent location to see Baltimore. It is a block away from a public-transit hub, including the light-rail line to BWI and various bus lines to major attractions not already within walking distance (e.g. Fell's Point). Found this hotel on Hotwire & got a great rate. Service was prompt and friendly. Can't beat the free Internet. Only downside is that its restaurant is overpriced for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton. Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: carol5029
Reviews.Content: This hotel really needs a Face Lift. The hotel may have been a 4-Star hotel twenty years ago. The lobby is great but when you hit your room you have just step into a twilight zone. The furniture is miss placed in a out date room from the past. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel on the edge”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: Highlighted as a conference hotel the Sheraton Baltimore is actually several blocks away from the convention centre. The hotel itself was OK but the location left little to be desired. Head less than a block north or west of the hotel and you're potentially in a challenging environment. My suggestion to anyone staying in the hotel is venture out and about in a pack!

Reviews.Title: “No Service, lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: PostcardsFromEurope
Reviews.Content: I always thought that staying in a sheraton was a safe option: You get standard rooms, standard service. The sheraton city center in Baltimore however was very disappointing. First the room: when I entered the room on the 15th floor I could hear the outside street traffic so cleary that I went to window to close it, unfortunately it was closed. Well as closed as possible, but I could feel the cold coming in, and more importantly the noise. I asked for antother room but did not get one. There is the continouos sound of cars, and all night long there are sirens, people yelling in the streets,...: so sleep quality is zero. Furthermore the room was rather small, the carpet dirty, the coffeemaker gave, even after several rinsing water with little black plastic bits in it. In the bathroom there was not one singel horizontal surface except for the floor, which was the only place where I could put my toiletries Then the service: after i manged to get a room service menu, it turned out that most items on the menu were not available, housekeeping took away the dirty towels, but the first two days they were not replaced by new ones, The hotel is very large but only has a small unappealing breakfast room/bar/restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Average Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The-4-Foremans
Reviews.Content: It's all about the experience and what you require as a customer. If you are looking for a place to sleep and get on with your business day then this will suffice. The room has all of the basics that you would expect from a sheraton but is lacking that little something extra to set it apart from the competition. The bedrooms are small. There is a small desk to allow you to get some work done. Make sure that you get wifi included with your room rate or it will be $13 a day for access. The room wasn't equipped with a tub or a minibar. If you need to hit the pillow early, you should bring your earplugs in the event that there is a hallway conversation occuring. The rooms are far from soundproof. The front desk staff are genuine and helpful. Need a car, the car park staff are fantastic and will assist without hesitation. The gift shop will allow you a chance to pickup souveniers as well as OTC medicaitons and toiletries. But don't expect service with a smile, eye contact or a 'have a nice day' on the way out. There is a bank machine in the lobby as well as just outside the main entrance. There is a caribou coffee shop on the corner to start your day and a subway down the street if you need a quick bite. The Inner Harbor is about a 20 minute walk away and you can get to the ball park and the football stadium in about the same amount of time. The neighbor hood was nice enough and I felt safe to walk the streets in the evening.. If you can't get a booking at the Sheraton Inner Harbor, this hotel will suffice. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families. But if you are htting Baltimore for business it will do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't what I'd expect from a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: ABTravelDine
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that my visit here wasn't the best. The overall hotel and lobby was very nice and there were some nice amenities. Plus this hotel had a decent location and was pretty close to the Inner Harbor. However, the biggest downfall of this hotel are the rooms. These rooms are just so small and the bathrooms are even smaller. I'm not a huge person, about 6'1" but the bathroom was beyond cramped. Plus the room size was a little too small then what you'd expect. But overall, this hotel is good for location, but not too great in comfort in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nancy12988
Reviews.Content: i stayed in Sheraton Baltimore City Center Hotel in July 2011 for 2 nights. We arrived late friday night and hotel location was scary. As I am from NYC and we are used to seeing homeless people here, but in the hotel area...they were everywhere. We were scared to park our car elsewhere as we were afraid it was going to be broken into. So for the first night, we paid for valet parking. The valet was $34 per night (pretty expensive in my opinion for a Sheraton hotel located in a crappy neighborhood but they probably charged so much since its in Baltimore and still a tourist attraction area). The hotel room was small compared to other Sheraton brand hotels I've stayed in. The hotel lobby was okay, nothing special but considering it's a category 3 hotel...you wouldn't expect a lot out of it. We were placed on the 10th floor and we can hear people in the next room talking and doors banging loudly in our hotel room. The pool was nice and we swam there during our stay. There was a lifeguard on duty and the water was clean. My one complaint about the pool area was that most of the chairs there were broken or had a ripe on them. Also there was a shortage of chairs to accommodate their hotel guests, we woke up extra early to be able to get a lounge chair every morning. THe gym was pretty decent size and had a variety of equipments. The hotel was about 6 blocks away from Inner Harbor so it was within walking distance. Watch out for your personal belongings as you are walking because there are lots of bums in the area and overall Baltimore is not a safe city. For the second night, we parked across the street in the self parking garage downstairs and we paid $10 for parking instead. Elevators were a bit freaky and old, but you had to use your car ticket in order to enter the elevator to go downstairs from the street level to pick up your card (a bit safer so this way strangers won't be allowed in). As a SPG member, I've stayed in various Sheraton brand hotel and would not recommend this one. If you are here to visit Inner Harbor, I highly recommend staying in Inner Harbor area as there are more tourist and the area is probably a bit safer (maybe Sheraton Inner Harbor hotel is a hotel choice to consider).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLTMGT
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sheraton Baltimore City Center for work. The hotel is centrally located and is within easy walking distance to most harbor attractions. Getting off the elevator in the South Tower I had a bad feeling - a drying fan was in my hallway which had the look / feel of a old hotel. However, the room was pleasantly modern - nice on the wall hd tv with comfortable room accomodations; i.e. bed was perfect; good work area for laptop(wireless was extremely fast). Bathroom was a little small, but it worked well!! Only restaurant on site is Shula's - looked a little pricey. I ordered room service - good food and timely service. Overall - a good place!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost flawless”
Reviews.Author: smontcat
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews I was hesitant about this hotel having stayed in 4 stars Inner Harbor on my visits. After an easy check-in and fantastic room---immaculate, comfortable and nicely decorated,I have to wonder why the negative reviews. The staff was exceptional. The only improvement is the walk from the front desk to the elevators was quite long. Again I have stayed in all 4 stars Inner Harbor prior to this visit and would check this hotel out before booking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A typical but very pleasant downtown hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: travellogger411
Reviews.Content: This downtown hotel is centrally located. Only 3-4 blocks from the convention center, and 5-6 blocks from the innerharbor restaurants and tourist area. The hotel is everything you'd expect from the Sheraton hotel chain in a downtown location. The hotel has a comfortable lobby, an good size excercise room, and in-house steakhouse restaurant. The front desk crew was very cordial and helpful. There was no concierge desk but the staff did their best to help us with restaurant choices. They gave us lots of options but did not seem to have a command of the local eateries so I'd do my own research before staying. My room looked like it had been recently remodeled and was furnished in contemporary hotel style. It was extemely clean and the airconditioning worked well (and quietly). The room was behind the elevator which I usually have concerns about but it was very quiet. You can hear the hallway conversation pretty clearly but the winding hallways which wrap around the central elevator shaft keep the foot traffic to a minimum. My room; which was on the small side and seemed 30 sq feet smaller than my co-traveller's room; did not have a chair to sit in, and the closet had no nearby light so it was dark but these are minor issues which would not deter me from staying here again. The room was shower only. Overall this would be the quality stay you'd expect from a Sheraton property. One of our party raved about the other Sheraton downtown on Charles Street (closer to inner harbor but farther from the convention center) so I'd have no reservations about staying here but would check on the other property as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Hansfords
Reviews.Content: We said one night at the Sheraton while attending a wedding. We got a great deal on Priceline and paid $111 including all fees. Parking is additional and costs about $22 per night, without valet service. We had two double beds and stayed on the 14th floor of the south tower. The staff was super friendly and went out of their way to assist us. Almost every employee we encountered greeted us. They offer free coffee, water, and tea in the restaurant. They were also able to assist us in finding good food delivery at 2:30am. The wedding site was located about 1 mile from the hotel and we decided to get a taxi due to the weather. There were dozens of taxis around the hotel. The room was cute, and the decor was simple. The bed was comfortable. There were some stains on the carpet and the wall paper in the bathroom needed to be wiped down.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a Couple of Nights”
Reviews.Author: AZ2MN
Reviews.Content: Good, not great, property due to age. Not pleased paying $240/night for a queen room in summer for what we got but must be market rate for downtown Baltimore. Generally clean room, but shower curtain had visible mildew and odor. Very friendly staff. Very well equipped exercise room overlooking a spacious pool on the roof of the 1st floor ballroom area. Within walking to the world-class Walters Art Gallery museum and the usual Baltimore tourist attractions. Shula's II is okay, but Tony's across the street on Park Avenue has excellent steak and crab cakes. Other good restaurants north on Charles St. including Cazbar, serving Turkish cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Autotestcon - Sheraton BCC Review”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the hotel and in particular Jazzaray and Kelly behind the desk. I had 5 people staying at the Hotel for the AutoTestCon conference and one of our rooms had a billing nightmare. Jazzaray was able to straighten everything out with a pleasant smile and in a very helpful way. She as also able to extend the stay of one of my team that saved us. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great for inner harbor and the city”
Reviews.Author: BCTravel091
Reviews.Content: Clean, good location, friendly people. Just wish they had more affordable parking fees. Plenty of nearby alternatives to choose from, still a good place to stay! Stayed for the Baltimore Grand Prix and it was terrific! Neighborhood is not the best but it was not an issue for us. People seemed to go about their business without concern.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: BullaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: A Sheraton hotel seems like a safe choice for a comfortable business trip hotel. But not this one. The location is horrible. The neighborhood seems to have suffered badly lately. There are as many properties boarded up as there are open nearby. It didn't feel like a safe place to walk at night, not even back and forth from the convention center and harbor area restaurants. Inside, the hotel looked pretty much like you would expect of a Sheraton. But whatever the cause, the air conditioning in my room was not operational. The temperature in my room was consistently over 80 degrees. I reported the problem the first three mornings, but got absolutely no resolution. Opening the windows accomplished very little besides letting in the constant drone of sirens all night. It was a truly miserable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene..Sheraton Accommodated”
Reviews.Author: LandaG
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to Baltimore and booked our stay at the Sheraton Baltimore City Center hoping to have a fantastic stay to celebrate our family reunion. Unfortunately, Hurricane Irene ruined our plans. When the bands from hurricane Irene arrived our room leaked. The force of the storm was unbelivable. We literally had to move at 1:00 a.m. in the morning after a tiring day. The hotel was more than accommodating and moved us to another room and gave us generous compensation for any Starwood preferred hotel - great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Sharfrog
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, we booked with priceline and got a good price. After reading the reviews we asked for the South tower and was on the 24th floor. We checked for bed bug evidence and found none so that was good! No tub, but not an issue for us. The worst was the crack in the window and the single pane glass which allowed ALL noise from outside to be heard! Also the pillows were too soft and went "flat". The service was great although alittle slow when requesting clean towels. They stored our bikes for us and it was a nice ride to inner harbor. Self park is cheaper and we could get to our car with no problems! No free wifi or continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Run - Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: tkari
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again... It was filthy!! I attended a conference and everyone I spoke with confirmed that this hotel was one of the worst hotels we have seen in a very long time...

Reviews.Title: “small room with stained sheets and blankets”
Reviews.Author: MishMish94
Reviews.Content: This is was my time visiting Baltimore. I was disappointed with Sheraton due to the below factors: 1) bed sheet and bankets and towels had "stained" 2) no bathtub 3) small room 4) service was unprofessional Hope this will help you narrow down your hotel search.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jlj22312
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference, so most of my review is based on that experience. The conf space was awful--bad AV, bad configurations, bad sound, bad temp, bad noise carryover, bad equipment. The food was completely under-whelming. Not bad, but not good. The staff was mixed. They were super friendly but not terribly good at their jobs. Friendly is great...but so is competence. The hotel room was okay. Not all that well-appointed though (i.e. no plugs where you need 'em, like on the desk--HELLO!!-- old clock radio, instead of one that plays/charges an iPod, etc.). The valet drained my battery, so I waited 30 mins for my truck. They helpfully informed me that 'it happens all the time here.' So apparently they don't learn... Lastly, the restaurant in the hotel had great food but the WORST service, so skip it. Skip it all, really.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: kkeelty
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton City Center is just an average hotel in downtown Baltimore with two separate towers (north and south). There are numerous nearby high rises that tend to block any sort of view (Inner Harbor, etc.), including the Raddison that is right across the street (and connected by a ramp above street level). Our room on the 18th floor was a corner unit with a king bed. The duvet was crazy heavy, to the point that it was dragged off the bed by it's own weight during the night. A small but clean bathroom, a desk with an office chair, a flat-screen TV, mini-fridge with nothing in it, an awkwardly placed closet, and a comfortable bed completed the room, but no extra pillows or a blanket (to use instead of the duvet). When I was there the hotel was experiencing a "internet is down" situation that made it impossible to access the web from the computers in the Business Center. After trying several times to access the internet in order to print out boarding passes for the next days flight, I made my way to the front desk, who then told me about the (apparent) hotel-wide internet blackout. Once I explained what I wanted to do, they directed me to the Concierge computer and let me use that. While it took a while to get the printing done (wait in line again, then tell front desk folks that the printing wasn't working, then have them futz around and confer with each other), the staff did make it happen. Eventually. Bottom line is that this is a reasonable choice in a reasonably convenient hotel, if you find a rate that is to your liking.

Reviews.Title: “Calm down.....this hotel is just fine”
Reviews.Author: Travelingmom h
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline for $65/night. I was absolutely mortified after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and I felt the need to let others know that there is no reason to be. I went armed with a flashlight and cup hunting for bed bugs( I didn't find any thank God). After reading the reviews I did request the south tower, since supposedly it is newer. The staff was completely nice about it. The only qualm I have is about the parking deck under the building. In order to have in & out privileges you have to go to the front desk and request a token each time you want to leave. Other than that, enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “I needn't have worried”
Reviews.Author: nitetalker
Reviews.Content: This was a Priceline booking -- $77/night for Wednesday and Thursday nights. I got concerned after reading the reviews that this might be the last time my wife would agree to booking through Priceline. I needn't have worried. Yes, our room -- and the bathroom -- was small. But we found both to be adequate. The room and bed were clean and comfortable and the furnishings were in good repair. The hallways were quite warm, though. We were treated well at check-in and by the concierge. We did not use the pool but we walked through the pool area and thought it looked very attractive. No, the hotel is not in the middle of urban blight as some have said. Some reviewers have advised to not walk north or west. Maybe the advice should be to not walk north AND west. We walked a few blocks west (to Starbucks at W. Baltimore and S. Eutaw) and the area was fine. As for the walk between the hotel and the inner harbor or the ballpark, it took us 8 or 9 minutes. Whether this is a burden will depend upon your degree of fitness and the weather. We did not find the location to be inconvenient to the tourist attractions although we would have preferred, of course, to be closer to the inner harbor. For more distant destinations I highly recommend using the free Charm City Circulator buses which run about every 15 minutes. Yes, parking is expensive -- particularly so if you use the hotel parking. As you near the front of the hotel heading west on W. Fayette St. you may think the hotel parking is the garage that has an entrance ramp right in the middle of the street. That's what I thought so I parked there. In reality the hotel parking is elsewhere -- the entrance is around two corners on W. Baltimore St. Where I parked is less expensive -- I paid $18/day -- than the hotel parking, several dollars less on most days. But you can do better: There is a garage on W. Baltimore St. either between S. Eutaw and S. Howard or between S. Howard or N. Liberty (I forget which) that was charging $14/day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, but I would stay near the Harbor for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KaycieD
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in terms of it is eye appealing, has amenities (nice fitness area, store, restraunt), has good front desk service, has an absolutely awesome and reasonably priced restraunt (compared to what you get and pay at the Harbor) and is in a decent location (although it is downtown and there are nearby places you shall not go alone or in the evening which I gather is a downtown thing - there are hotels all around). What I liked about the room is the large flat-screen TV, and nice desk and comfortable desk chair; the huge wall-sized window with nice heavy curtains over a privacy curtain; the absolutely most comfortable bed I've ever slept in with 4 huge of the most comfortable pillows (King bed); a nice big dressing mirror next to the closet; the electric thermostat which responds and cools/heats immediately; and the 'modern' look of the bathroom. What I didn't like about the room was the carpet needs cleaning very bad, the price - at the business rate it was $144 before tax (I'm not sure I would want to pay much more for the regular rate); the bath towels are a little too bleachy (had to wash my face and arms a couple of times after drying); and there aren't any premium movie channels on the television - - they push their pay per view movies. Iffy about the room is the shower - it's a tiled stand-up shower with a curtain, no tub. Wasn't really an issue for me but if a tub is important to you for whatever reason know ahead there is not one. Iffy about the hotel for me was at check-in they tried to sell me on changing my room preference to two beds, and the reasoning they gave me (bigger room) just didn't prove to be true and they tried to lure me with promises of 'try to find' a better room for me the next day (I didn't give up my king bed but have had the opportunity to view other rooms). Also, I am on business rate, but my window view is half concrete roof, my coworkers also have crappy views. If I were on vacation I would be somewhat disappointed because 1) there are hotels nearer the Harbour (which is where all the activity is) including another Sheraton (it's about a 25 minute slow-paced walk from here, and remember later at night its iffy if you should be out and about on foot) and 2) there are other hotels that are higher up having many views of the Harbour. If I was going to spend this kind of money, i'd even spend a little more and go for location to the Harbour and a hotel that might could promise me a good view. I'd recommend this as a good business hotel. They also have a nice business center. I stayed here for a conference. Let me say right now that if you're planning a conference, make sure this hotel can handle the capacity you anticipate. This one seemed to have difficulty with the size conference I'm at - - the rooms are wall to wall table, leg to leg chairs, stuffy, not sound-proof from next door rooms, and the conference area at classroom transition resembles Hollywood Boulevard on a Premier night. The conference food/snacks is terrible, staff and setup unorganized, and just total chaos of a massive sea of bodies.

Reviews.Title: “Above & Beyond on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: steve s
Reviews.Content: Greg, I hope this finds you doing well. I want to make you aware of a recent stay in your hotel. Once a year I get together with my three brothers and my father in a location not far from his home outside of Harrisburg, PA. Last year we traveled to Bethlehem, PA and this year we chose Baltimore, MD and the Sheraton Baltimore City Center Hotel. We purchased three rooms. From the moment we arrived we were pleased with the professionalism and hospitality of your staff at the your hotel. The front desk staff was quick and polite and your concierge Christine Vissett was a ray of sunshine and couldn’t have been any nicer. We were celebrating my father’s 80th birthday and the staff at the hotel made all of us feel welcome. Please thank your General Manager Chris Phillips and your Chef Felix Nunez and the rest of their staff for a great hotel experience. Even your car service personnel in the front of the hotel went above and beyond in customer service. Their dedication, hard work and leadership made this weekend a success. Please thank them for their investment of time, energy and talent. Thanks, Steve

Reviews.Title: “not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: Allison J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a stop over from SC back home to NY. It was ok. Rooms are small. Bathrooms are small as well. They make you pay for Wi-fi, which is crazy and you pay for parking, $34 to be exact. Next road trip we won't be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling”
Reviews.Author: yogourt_junkie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for several days in Baltimore. I will try to give an objective and honest review which will help the travelers and hotel: Cons: 1. Bed bugs: I have checked in to a room in the North tower. The check in was on time. The first room looked ok, but pillows and duvet had stains of blood that dried long time ago. It looks liked being washed, but clearly the blood did not go away. I have reported the problem and the cleaning staff replaced the duvet and the pillows on the same day. I did not open my luggage. I went to bed only in underwear. Soon, I have noticed a bed bug on a second pillow. The bed bug came out from the edge of the bed from the mattress. I have quickly taken a new band aid and carried alive the bed bug to the front desk. The staff member was quite surprised, but he quickly gave me new room and apologized for the inconvenience. He started making a report for the hotel and assured the room will be closed down for an investigation. When I returned to room, I saw another bed bug on the pillow that came out again from the mattress/bed edge. I have taken the bed bug alive back to the front desk. He has again apologized and said he will report it in his report. This was around midnight. Next, I have checked in to another room in the North tower. There were 2 beds. On both beds the pillows had stains of blood that dried up, but clearly the pillows looked washed. I was afraid now to even sleep on the bed. I slept for 1 hour on a chair, but I was so tired I went to a bed after removing all pillows and duvet. There was only 1 sheet and mattress. Around 3:00 a.m. in the morning I have woken up to notice another bed bug in a distance of 5-10 cm away from me coming from the mattress/bed edge. I have again brought it back to the front desk and have been given another room. Luckily, I did not even open my luggage. So, I went to a third room in the South tower. In the third room, I was again afraid to sleep on the bed due to previous shocking experience with bed bugs in 2 other rooms. I tried to sleep on a chair all night, but I could not sleep at all on a chair. The room had stains of blood and mascara on the bed, towels and walls. Next, morning I have checked out. The front desk manager offered to dry clean all my clothes and bags, but I did not even open them when I checked in. However, they have mentioned this could help me to avoid bringing any bed bugs home. I think bed bugs spread in the whole building by the duvet, sheets and pillows replaced between rooms and cleaning department. Bed bugs from the pillows and duvet spread to the cleaning department and then brought to other rooms. Or by the clothes of other clients who brought their clothes for cleaning to the bell captain's desk. I had to change several rooms in less than 12 hours due to bed bugs. I could not even sleep properly and was tired and exhausted after this stay. 2. The carpets, walls, towels, duvet, sheets, pillows, the sofa have stains of blood, mascara, or other liquids. Clearly, there is a problem with cleaning and bed bugs. 3. The rooms are quite sound proof, but you can still hear some noise of the sirens of emergency cars. This was not a big problem as bed bugs though. 4. Some of walls and ceiling had certain problems. They were patched or falling down. However, this was not as bad as bed bugs again. Pros: 1. The staff and hotel manager are generally nice, friendly and helpful. They offered their help whenever they can. When the incident with bed bugs happened, they have offered to dry clean the cloths and luggage to make sure I will not bring it home. 2. I was offered a full refund and there was no problem with billing. So, the billing is done fast and efficiently. 3. The wireless internet is fast. There is an option to pay by hour, day and week. Although, it would have been better to have it for free as part of hotel membership like some other places do. 4. Location is good. There is a downtown and inner harbor near by. Although, after 8 p.m. you may see more homeless and strange people in the downtown area, but this is a more of a problem for the whole Baltimore in general. Inner Harbor was nice though during the day. It has some interesting places to visit around. 5. The concierge was helpful and knowledgeable as well. She tried to explain and guide to the best places to visit. 6. The first floor of the hotel looked nice. Recommendation to the Hotel: - Rooms should be checked for bed bugs and be disinfected at least every week not every 5 or 6 months. This will make sure such incidents do not happen. Although, the aftermath of the incident was handled well, but the preventive measures need to be addressed and improved drastically to avoid such problems. - The stained items (e.g. duvet, pillows, sheets) needs to be replaced more efficiently. Although, washing was done on these items, but the stain still remains. This looked very disgusting. Recommendation for Guest: - clearly check your pillows and linen for blood stain as this could be a first sign of the previous bed bug presence.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, nicely placed”
Reviews.Author: In79days
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel, and very helpful and friendly staff. I had a few problems with parking (valet was completely jammed, and the self park card they gave me didn't work), but they went out of their way to make it up, and overall, I was really impressed with the hotel. I was particularly impressed with the front desk staff, who were really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “incompetent, borderline theft, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: paythepenguin
Reviews.Content: We booked a Saturday night stay at this hotel on Priceline. When we arrived we were told they were overbooked and they refused to honor the reservation at that location or at any other hotel in downtown Baltimore. Far worse, they told us our money would be refunded via Priceline, but then we were charged a CANCELLATION FEE. And Priceless told us they paid the cancellation fee to the hotel, so they could not refund it to us! We are still trying to get our money refunded. I recommend you do not place any trust in the staff or management of this hotel. Spring for the Hotel Monaco, down the street, which is more expensive, but has friendly staff that do not try to steal your money -- they'll even give you a pet goldfish for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: milena229
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend trip with friends. Our room was clean and in good condition. Our friend's room needed to be cleaned a few times in a 2 day stay because it was quite dirty. The concierge was very nice. However, the woman that worked the front desk are unfriendly and treated us like we were inconveniencing them. All in all, it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible communication from staff”
Reviews.Author: Domp423
Reviews.Content: rom the first phone call that I made to the Sheraton Baltimore city center hotel I encountered problem after problem. The staff that received my initial reservation was unclear on the terms, which led to me having to pay a higher rate then first quoted. Secondly I was not told that the reservation was non-refundable, not that I intended to cancel, I just wanted the option available to me if it was necessary. Thirdly, a day after I checked out I was charged an additional $50 because I was told that they did not charge me enough at the time of my initial checkout, and then the staff was rude to me when I called to question why I was charged more money after checkout. Overall I would probably never stay at the Sheraton Baltimore city center ever again, and I am unsure if I would stay at another Sheraton property again if this is an example of the service that I would receive

Reviews.Title: “Nice people but our bathroom flooded”
Reviews.Author: Justicefishy
Reviews.Content: So, where to start. My party ended up in a single room at the Sheraton for Otakon 2011, a local Japanese animation convention. Beyond the great location, the front desk hotel staff were great. The check in was efficient, quick, and very well taken care of despite the masses of people there. We arrived at 6:45, we had our car taken care of and we were in our room at 7:10. The valet was pretty inexpensive ($34 for three nights of parking, though it may have been per night but I'm not sure as they only charged us $34). Further, their platinum club lounge (as the one who booked the room was a platinum club member) was superb. The food was great, the people were wonderful. Finally, their bag check was efficient, well run, and very good. On the other hand, there were many many issues. First and foremost, our bathroom flooded. It happens. They were quick in fixing it but it's still an issue. They also forgot our towels one day, though they did deliver new ones upon being told. Their website was also very inaccurate as it advertised free wireless internet in the common areas despite there being no such service. On top of that, they lacked a book of amenities in the room and did not provide one; being hungry at 3 AM and wishing for room service or some sort of map, we were unable to procure one. The website was also very unhelpful, lacking hours and locations of things. Finally, it seemed that getting a card remagnitized without all four cards there would reset all cards and prevent them from working, meaning that by the end of the trip, we had only a single working card and no real means of obtaining new working ones. The neutral in this case was the room situation. We had 4 people in a room, one of which did not wish to share the bed and as he was paying, one had to sleep on the floor, me. As such, while I cannot attest to the comfort of the beds, they seemed nice. The room was of adequate size as well, though it lacked a refrigerator which was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: otaku29
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed the Sheraton for a convention at the end of July 2011. We booked this hotel because it was 2 blocks away from the convention center which was very nice. We arrived Thursday afternoon. The check in process was easy, and pretty fast considering all of the con-goers arriving for the weekend. The room was pretty nice. But the air conditioning was not working and we had to call the front desk. The maintenance man was very quick to respond and fixed the a/c unit in a matter of minutes. We used the self park option instead of the valet, and the parking lot was full. I'm not sure how their lot could have been full, but we found a public lot that was cheaper since the Sheraton did not provide free parking. Our main disappointment was with the wording on the web site. I did not book the trip, so I can't say what was or was not there, however the paperwork we had said high speed internet was a room accommodation, however you had to pay $12.95 per day and because of the poor wording we were expecting to have wi-fi service included. When I checked the site from my smart phone it stated that it was $9.95 per day, and when i attempted to access the internet on my iPod it said it was $12.95 just as the front desk stated. I do not recall seeing anything on the site stating that the price was subject to change. The hotel did have a free internet connection just off of the lobby, however there were only 2 desktop and 2 ethernet connections available, which, with the type of convention that was being held, would be hard to gain access to. We did manage to get on Thursday night. We had to log in with our room number and a timer came up that said we had an hour on the computer. We didn't go over the hour limit, but there was another counter for any minutes that you went over. I assume you would have been charged extra time, but I did not see any signs anywhere clarifying the internet limitations. At the end of the session the computer automatically cleared the history and readied itself for the next guest to log in. Again, I'm not sure of the wording on the website, but we were also under the impression that we were getting a complimentary breakfast, however it was only complimentary for business conventions held at the hotel. There was a buffet we would have to pay for in the hotels bar/restaurant that we did not go to. Other than the cleaning staff not fully restocking the room every day, cups, number of towels, and the essential toilet paper which we had to ask for, the hotel was pretty nice. Bottom line, for the price we paid, and the unclear wording on the site, we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay.”
Reviews.Author: leceltique
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on hotwire for this hotel. Stopped there for one night on a longer trip. The room was clean, although the hallways are a little dark and could use some cleaning. Pool was okay but it could use a little renovating. Pool closed at 7PM which seem a little early, however there is a life guard on duty. The area around the hotel seems okay, but in general Baltimore is very scary looking place. When I asked the front desk if it was safe to walk to Harbour Place with my family, she answered "With you...." refering to my 6'1" frame, "no problem". Not the answer I was hoping for. The best thing about the hotel was the Shula's Two restaurant. Expensive...yes, but good food and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deal on Jr Suite Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: stymie77
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Baltimore for a trade show in July, temps were over 100. Get a good rate from the Sheraton website and was able to get a Jr Suite upgrade for $50 and it was worth the money. Stayed on top floor but had to keep curtains closed due to the heat. Bed was very comfortable! Suite upgrade give you Club level benefits which is good for weekdays but have no value on weekends. Hotel overall is good except neighborhood which is not too safe in evenings

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eulalee
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would say this is a mediocre hotel with mediocre service. I would advise that you never pay full price, otherwise you will not get value for your money. I paid $119US/nite thru hotels.com and I would say I have had better service at those $90US/nite places. I would never stay here again or recommend it. I stayed at this hotel because I needed to be close to the University of Maryland's campus for a conference I attended. It was hard to decide whether to stay here because the reviews were so polarized. People really loved it or they hated it. This is because the staff is not all at the same level of customer service. So if you happen to get all the bad ones you will have a horrible experience and vice versa. Indeed there is a small area to pull up in front of the hotel. The bellstaff at the door were wonderful. They greeted me and helped me with my bags to the front desk. At the front desk I felt like I had now entered motel 8. It was dark and uninviting. The receptionist never looked at me or welcomed me to the hotel. he looked at his keyboard the whole time. Room The room was clean and comfortable but there is no microwave or fridge. There is a big flatscreen tv but everything takes so long to load up. The phone was blinking with a message. It was a message from the staff wishing some other guest Happy July 4th. One would think messages get cleared when people check out. I wasn't impressed with the housekeeping department. The clock was blinking and never set. The one time they did clean my room, the bedside table and phone still seemed dusty and there was still strands of hair on the shower wall. The 2nd night housekeeping didn't bother cleaning my room at all(I read another review where someone also experienced this). I had returned to my room so late, I decided to go to sleep and forego the mediocre cleaning service. The next morning when I told the front desk receptionist, Jazarry M., she glares at me and says, "Did you put up the do not disturb?" I tell her I did not and ask if it is the hotel policy to clean every other day. She stares blankly and says nothing. At the very LEAST she could have apologized. And excellent customer service would have offered me a free night parking or something. There happened to be a conference there with lots of teens and 20 something people and I could hear them down the halls. The walls are so thin and I heard someone vomiting all night in the room next to me. The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth. Pool and gym Pool is nice and outdoors on the cabana level in the north tower. However it was corded off separating the shallow from deep and this prevented one from doing laps and it tended to be a bit crowded. But I must admit it was 109 degrees when I was there. The gym is clean and nice with available towels in the gym. General surroundings The neighboring streets are dingy, with panhandlers. Its not a place you make obvious that you are new to the area especially as female traveling alone as I was. I opted to park in the valet parking which is $34US/day and you can take the car in and out as often as you like without additional charges. I did see other garages that charged $12US/day about a block away. The neighboring restaurants seemed dingy. But I was told the Inner harbor is nice with nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Sheets like sandpaper”
Reviews.Author: scubaelf
Reviews.Content: Everything else about the hotel was acceptable, but the sheets were the worst I have ever slept on. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST EVER!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ashleeg29
Reviews.Content: Let's start from the front on bldg. NO PARKING! You have to pay $20 dollars a day to park and maybe more if you remove your car from the lot at anytime. So, if you leave for lunch ($20) and leave for dinner ($20) etc....You have to pay for internet (14$ a day) and that cuts out sometimes. We had to call tech support 3 times!!! The hallway smelled and the carpet was wet and dirty in hallway. In front of our room door was dental floss (used) and it stayed there for the entire stay!! Cleaning people NEVER PICKED IT UP!!! NASTY! In the room the tv had static, no fridge or microwave, the bathroom had stains on the WALLS!!!!!! and sheets smelled like boo boo! They came to change sheet and the next set smelled like popcorn and feet!! The location was ok if you like homeless people following you to your car! And people using drugs around corner. The south tower need to be town down and started over again!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!! And I only paid $90 and it wasn't even worth that!!!!! I would pay $30 a night for the place.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: johnkeith87
Reviews.Content: I was a little reluctant staying at this hotel for our weekend getaway after reading some scary reviews. Our experience really turned out to be great. First thing I have to say is that the hotel staff is one of the most friendly and polite I have encountered in a while. We checked in around midnight and were given a king room on the 26th floor in the south tower. There was a church convention going on that we did have to make our way through to get to the elevators. The room was great, comfortable beds, great starbucks coffee in the rooms, beautiful views. Really, the room was very nicely renovated and my partner and I couldn't understand why all the negative comments we have read. We encountered one problem while we were there with our room being serviced and the front desk was extremely appologetic and offered us a voucher at shula's for our inconvienance. It certainly made up for our issue. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. If you are worried about the area, don't be. Just stick to the busy streets to and from the harbor and you will be safe. They have tons of cops for security and there are many people walking the streets so you don't feel alone.

Reviews.Title: “Most uncomfortable hotel room ever”
Reviews.Author: crabbyharper
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by a family member for a large group for a wedding. We were assigned a king size room with a walk-in shower. I am somewhat mobility impaired. The bed was high, there was only one chair - a metal torture device that also was too high for my feet to reach the floor. There was no place I could sit to put on my shoes. The bed was lumpy, the duvet was heavy and too hot, and a party next door went on until the wee hours. The hallways were dark, dim and threatening. The traffic was awful, so we chose valet parking - expensive but worth it. Bell service was slow - "Oh, we are so busy now." The person who booked the room paid up front for all of us. For at least two rooms, my own included, we were charged the full rate for the room despite the orginal booker's receipts! I hope she got it straightened out - we could hardly wait to get out of there in the morning. The good thing was the snack and beer we had in the restaurant. Food quality excellent, service slow but the waitress was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mb1991
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire, and upon check-in we were made to feel like 2nd class citizens. The room was very comfortable. The hotel is situated in downtown Baltimore, and during the night we were awakened by sirens at least 3 times. It did have a great gym and the pool deck was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “smelly bathroom”
Reviews.Author: travel4011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the week of 07/18/11. First of all I wish the hotel keeps the transportation options information up to date on their website. Got a room with a shower only.
