The bathroom was small and smelled really bad, like dirty rags smell. I don't think they ever cleaned the shower curtain. It had stain on the bottom of it.

Reviews.Title: “A REAL BLESSING”
Reviews.Author: fitR99
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because the other Hotels were all sold out since the city was filled with so may church conventions. ALL I CAN SAY IS...I'm glad that I selected this hotel. From the time I arrived up to the time I left....everything was great.... The rooms, the ENTIRE staff, the fitness facility.. OH SO W O N D E R F U L!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Dreamstar777
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at approximately 4:30 on a Saturday afternoon, tired and exhausted after driving north all day. We couldn't believe our eyes when we entered the lobby. It looked like NY Penn Station. People were everywhere. We finally found our way to the end of the check in line which swirled and wrapped around the open lobby. Literally one hour and ten minutes later, we arrived at the front desk, only to be told that our room was not ready yet. The clerk showed us where we could go to have our luggage held if we wanted to go to dinner or hit the harbor while we waited. And so we did. She stated that she believed the room would be ready within the hour and proceeded to take down my number, agreeing to call me when it was ready. Well, 3 1/2 hours later, still no word from the hotel. We had pretty much done everything there was to do at the harbor at this point and were ready to just turn in. I was through with the Sheraton, so I called Priceline and demanded a refund. Priceline called the hotel to confirm my story of not being called yet. The Sheraton informed them that they were overbooked but requested that before they refunded my money, they wanted to offer me compensation. They also promised to have a room available for us within five minutes. We returned to the hotel and spoke with a clerk who was well aware of our situation. She offered us "free parking". Was she serious? We declined, called back Priceline who in turn called the hotel and I received a full refund at 10:30 pm. What did we do about accomodations that night? We decideded to just haul it in. From Baltimore, we were just 2 1/2 hours from home and Baltimore was the last stop from a week long southern road trip. We sucked it up and drove home. It was worth saving the money.

Reviews.Title: “Chaos in the Lobby!”
Reviews.Author: scouty3
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 3pm and waited a hour and a half to check-in & secure our room! There were at least 80 to 100 people standing in line to check-in as well. We were told this was due to large groups arriving at the same time and rooms not being cleaned!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Sheraton I've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: iloveulongtime
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Sheratons all my life...and I have a prefered member's card, but this one was just average. It's not bad, and I would probably stay again, but it does what it suppose to do. Let's start with front desk, somewhat helpful, somewhat nice. The rooms, kind of small, especially the bathrooms. But the one thing I hate, and this is ALL Sheratons, is the fee for a fridge....we're in 2011, all rooms should have fridges at no cost. If the Marriots can do it, why can't Sheraton, that gets on my nerves. Parking, one thing I can't stand is to pay for parking when I'm staying at a hotel, the hotel is not located in Manhattan, it's Baltimore! The fee should be opt out for GUESTS. Another thing that can improve this hotel is to have a vending machine with snacks and milk (for kids)....at night, there's nothing around the hotel: except for a 7-11, but the neighborhood is kind of rough, not the safest, so it's not a good idea walking in the middle of the night..in Baltimore. Lastly, the hotel is NOT exactly next to the harbout...it's a good 10-15min walk until you reach the harbour. To sum up: good stay, but hotel can improve....oh yes, the pool closes at 8pm, that's kind of lame, it should at least stay open until 10pm - it's summer, if it doesn't get used now, when will it?

Reviews.Title: “Book elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: jennsar
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5:30 pm & didn't get into room until 6:30. Only one room was ready: we reserved 2. Got ready in the one room we had keys for. By 8:30pm, when we left for our event (late, because of the wait to check in), the second room still wasn't ready. Front desk was nice, so not their fault. They said the cleaning crew couldn't clean the 400 rooms in time (from checkout at 11am to 3pm), which caused a >1 hour backlog on checking guests in. At 1am, when we came back from our event, John Beam, the night manager, was rude and argumentative. The room he gave us was in another tower, so we would've had to pack our stuff up & trek it all the way over there at 1 am. We decided just to sleep in the one room. All in all, it was the worst experience any of us had ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable...AGAIN! Even in the dark!”
Reviews.Author: thebee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Baltimore City Center for a five day conference. The conference was during a time when the hotel was at capacity because Bono (U2) was in town and the Orioles had home games...it was packed! During the second day of my stay, two major transformers in downtown Baltimore blew causing a major power outage at the hotel. The hotel desk staff and management JUMPED into action! While the outage was completely out of the hotel's control...NOT THEIR FAULT people...they went out of their way to take care (to the best of their ability) of each guest's need. It is true that anything electrical did not work including making (electrical) keys, toilets, water and air conditioning, BUT..the hotel broke out bottled water, wine, beer, trays and trays of food for guests waiting in the lobby and apologized over and over and over. It was a difficult day for everyone involved but, the hotel management did their VERY BEST to accommodate any need of their guests. After the power was restored, management was vacuuming and doing everything possible to restore the hotel after the crisis.They even gave free internet to guests because their system was rebooting and their were difficulties. Our event was interrupted by the power outage (no power point programs for our speaker) but, came off smoothly because we were so well taken care of. Our attendees (250) felt very cared for by this hotel considering the power outage was OUT OF THEIR CONTROL. Personally, my room was clean, comfortable and consistent with Sheraton standards....very nice! The desk staff (Alicia most especially) was so professional and caring to me and those from my conference checking in and out. The GM, Chris was delightful and worked his tail off the full five days I stayed. He had a wonderful attitude and rolled his sleeves up and did all he could during the power outage crisis...and once power was restored, he got everything running smoothly in the hotel, very quickly! Pat Palmere who we worked with to set up and run the conference is INCREDIBLE. Her professionalism and positive attitude in all circumstances make this hotel OUTSTANDING. I visited the historic area...FREE art museum two blocks up, Inner Harbor and an Oriole game (walked to and from and felt completely safe). I like the location of the hotel and always felt safe walking to and from the Inner Harbor and the Camden Yards. I believe the area is not any different than other big city areas (Chicago, Dallas, Vegas, Charlotte, SF....etc.), in safety. I used the gorgeous pool (they even have a lifeguard ON DUTY) but not the work-out room although many of my fellow conferees did and raved about it! Loved lunch and dinner at the restaurant and the conference breakfast and lunch buffets were scrumptious...kudos to the chef! When I read other reviews I am perplexed by what people write. The lobby staff is gushing with friendliness and smiles and helpfulness, the rooms are ample size in a downtown city hotel and are tastefully decorated, neat and clean. The lobby is lovely, common areas are tastefully decorated and elevators are fast. I am not sure what people are complaining about...I travel often and this is a great hotel! When our organization returns to Baltimore, The Sheraton Baltimore City Center will be our hotel of choice. The power outage was not the hotel's fault and yet they went above and beyond necessary means to make everyone comfortable. This says volumes about the management and those they hire...and I will support that! My second stay was enjoyable AGAIN...and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonylec
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 3pm which is the normal checkin time; room wasn't ready. Got the room at 6pm, and room was dirty (ie bathroom not cleaned). Staff unfriendly, unhelpful. Wifi is 13$ a day and not even free in the lobby. Parking is 24$ a day, outrageous for Baltimore. Nicer options in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “We found it a good place despite other reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: sgardner42379
Reviews.Content: We bought a weekend at this hotel at a bargain price on Hotwire, so we had to pay for it before we knew which hotel we got. We wanted to be near, not necessarily on, the Inner Harbor of Baltimore for a long weekend. After I paid and got the name of the hotel, I read the reviews and was hesitant to come, BUT, I would definitely say this hotel is nice, and worth a 6 block walk to the Harbor - and we saved a lot of money. Parking is limited in Baltimore, so we are parked across the street in a parking garage. Self park is $19 a day, valet park is $28 a day. The lobby is spacious and clean, you can easily get a taxi, but we found the 6 block walk refreshing. 3 blocks to the right, then 3 blocks next right, and you're at The Harbor. The rooms here are "miniature" - ours was clean, comfortable bed, decent view, outdated bathroom, but still clean with plenty of towels, big screen TV. I would have liked a small refrigerator for wine, or leftovers, or cheese and fruit we bought at the Farmers Market, but there isn't a fridge. The rooms are quite small - we are average size people, but I think large people would be claustrophobic, particularly in the bathroom. You can hardly turn around in there, and there is little room beside the bed. Funny thing was that the full length mirror was on the wall right next to the bed, so you'd actually have to stand on the bed, or the other side of the room to see yourself. No lamp on the desk. There is an ice/wine bucket, and small coffeepot with Starbucks coffee. For our purposes, we were fine - we wanted close, clean, basic, and good price - that is what we got. If you want closer, fancy, more amenities, look elsewhere. We would definitely recommend, and would stay here again. There is a Shula's restaurant in the hotel but we didn't eat there. We ate at the Harbor - so many food choices there.Highly recommended - Phillips Seafood Kitchen, Mo's Crab and Pasta in Little Italy, Rusty Scupper. We took the water taxi all over for $10 a day. Great shopping, great city tours and boat tours, you can find out everything you need to know in the Visitors Center where there are clean restrooms. At the hotel, internet access is $13 a day in your room, but there are four computers in the lobby that you can use free. At one point we needed towels, at another point we needed a corkscrew - both were provided immediately. The National Aquarium is here, but we didn't have the grandkids with us, so we'll save that for another time. Baltimore Inner Harbor is gorgeous, great destination, and we would recommend this hotel even though so many other reviews didn't care for it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected!!1”
Reviews.Author: kbuschman2
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here with my wife. Yes, the neighborhood might be a bit shady, but If you are looking for an economical place to stay, this is the place. The gym was really nice, and the pool was clean but nothing to flashy...The room was a bit small, but it did the job. The staff was friendly, and helpful.. I guess the only bad thing about this place is the restaurant downstairs...Wow, this place is dated. They didn't even have HD tv's. It looks like Don Shula doesn't want to spend money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: skoog1024
Reviews.Content: During recent trip to see the Orioles play, was told by reservations this hotel was within 2 blocks of Camden Yards. This is not true. While there is a Sheraton closer, this location was a good 8-10 blocks from the stadium and not in a good or safe feeling section of town. Like many Sheratons, it has seen its better days. Being concerned regarding the age of the hotel, I asked the front desk if the rooms were in good shape. (Unfortunately I had prepaid for our rooms, using a non-refundable rate to get a lower price, which I will never do again!) I was told with a straight face the rooms had just been "completely" refurbished 2 years ago. If this is true, they did not get their money's worth. Hallways were dark, with water stained and peeling wallpaper. Rooms were small, old and dirty, with stained unvacumned carpets. Bathrooms were small and smelled of mildew. Had to use the flashlight on my phone when entering the room, because all the light fixtures, with the exception a simple lamp, were not working or had no bulbs in them. Miserable experience. Don't stay here! After this expereince I wouldn't stay at the other Sheraton either. There were two nice looking hotels much closer to the ball park, a Hyatt and a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite to Sheraton Standards!”
Reviews.Author: jrferreras100
Reviews.Content: Very small bathrooms, a/c not at its 100%, overpriced Internet simply not to Sheraton Standards!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: McYek
Reviews.Content: We visited the day they happened to have three transformer go out for 11 hours which is highly unusual. So there was no electricity. It was 95 degrees out that day so without AC, it was hot. We arrived as the power was just getting back on line but they were still in recoverly mode. The staff had complimentary food and drinks for all the guests in the lobby. Under very difficult circumstances, each and every staff member we encountered were working their hardest to accomodate guests. They were gracious, professional and calm. It was very impressive. So kudos to the Sheraton staff! Our room was very clean and nice. The hotel is a very short taxi drive away from the water, Little Italy and both stadiums. Tony's diner nearby is not optimally decorated but the food is great. All and all we were impressed with the Sheraton and would come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby but rooms need a face lift”
Reviews.Author: neshehan
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel provide a nice location for getting around town, it appears the rooms (at least those in the north tower) need a little help. Once I checked in and received wonderful customer service, I made it to my room only to see several signs of a worn out room. Although surrounded by windows, the curtains were torn, the desk was broken, the phone was disconnected and the space was quite small. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is trying...the restaurant has a nice bar and staff goes out of their way to provide good service. All and all, for one might on business, it was alright. However, if I was on vacation I would probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is non existent today!”
Reviews.Author: MKL15
Reviews.Content: I am in the Travel industry myself, but this is a new one for me. I tried to check in during a power outage. The person behind the desk (Lauren Simpson) told me: "you can't, the computers are down". That is it, no excuses, or feeling were shared. When I asked about changing to the other Sheraton in town, she said: "I can probably call, but they are sold out". OK, I went to stroll the town. I came back about 2 hours later and and the power was back on. After standing in a line for 20 mins I had the luck of checking in with Lauren once more. Again, no apology for the long line or the still not fully air conditioned lobby, no I just was welcomed back with: "Name?". Then she could not find my reservation and asked me: "do you have a confirmation number?" Again, no apologies or anything for the inconvenience of not finding the reservation. I had to get into another line to get my bag first for the reservation number. When i returned to the front desk, I was helped by a much friendlier person who was apologetic. But I heard Lauren still snapping at other guests ("your room is not ready" - stare). I book a lot of my travel group business at Starwood hotels and usually stay there myself as well on business trips. But this is a first to have experienced this. I understand that it has been hot in the hotel for the last 10-12 hours or so, but if you can;t handle it, then you should not be working in the service industry. Happenings like this should make it a challenge to make other people happy! Mklocker - (room is fine though)

Reviews.Title: “Scary, pricey and in a bad part of town. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttB018
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a dump. Rooms were old, dirty and cramped. Beds are old and uncomfortable. The 'valet' service was helpful, but is a front for expensive private taxi company. DO NOT walk around the area alone, especially at night, as there are many crimes and assaults in the immediate area. There was no hot water on the first day of our stay, the front desk refused any type of reimbursement or compensation. The restaurant, Shula's 2 in the lobby is overpriced, dirty and just plain bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: nefariousvegas
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on some concert tickets and decided to make it a weekend in Baltimore. We found an awesome deal on the Sheraton, which was directly across the street from the 1st Mariner Arena, the concert venue. So, needless to say, the hotel was extremely convenient. (And the deal was almost too good to be true, but it was!) We stayed in a corner suite on the 22nd floor of the North Tower (for $99!). The room was great -- with wonderful downtown views on two sides. We had a separate area and the bedroom, plus a small kitchenette area (with real Starbucks coffee packs!) which was nice. The room had seen better days, but all in all it wasn't bad. The bathroom was very small, though, for the size of the suite. The only tiny gripe is that after I made my reservation, the web site asked if I would like to have club lounge access, which included evening snacks and a continental breakfast, for $15. I clicked yes and a screen popped up letting me know that they would send an email within 48 hours if "space" was available for the club lounge. I never received an email. When we checked in, I explained that we wanted the club lounge access. I was told that the club lounge was not open on weekends. Guess I wished they would somehow fix the web site so that the option doesn't come up when you book a weekend room. As I said, small gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely needs an update”
Reviews.Author: kareny13
Reviews.Content: Feels old and dated; no attention to detail - as if nothing has changed there in decades. Check in desk Thanked me 3x for staying with me but well not other info - if I was getting an upgrade or my choice of Welcome gift (both as a Platinum Starwood member). So not sure if I got the upgrade - but a corner room which just not tastefully done. Randon microwave on which the coffee service machine sat on top. No Laundry bags. Somehow the toilet was fitted behind the bar stands of the sink, you you had to neogotiate between the sink bar stands in order to flush the toilet. Had to ask about the Club Lounge -- which for some reason doesnt open on weekend; though the Lounge Door does give Sat & Sunday hours. Was given a breakfast coupon -- which I was able to use for the Buffett -- good buffett and very nice staff. The hotel bill came under the door with a page saying to do the key drop off in the enclosed envelope, but no envelope was included. Gym was fairly good. Just kinda shotty all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel bordering on a sketchy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DawgmanOH
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for one night as an SPG Gold (working on getting Platinum back via the challenge!). As others have stated, very, very nice staff. Really fantastic and pleasant. Got an upgraded room in the South Tower and a nice bag of goodies (chocolate bar, water, apple, coupons) upon check in. Room was typical Sheraton (which is good) and had a nice view of the city. Good tv channel access. Can't comment on the gym as I hit snooze and didn't go! Both USA Today and WSJ as well as Baltimore Sun were complimentary in the lobby. The only negative is that if you start venturing at night one block or so either North and/or West, it gets a bit sketchy. Not dangerous, but sketchy. I know this is not the hotel's fault, because it is where it is, but should be taken into consideration. I would definitely stay again, as the hotel itself is fantastic. Well done, Baltimore City Center!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but bland room with subpar service”
Reviews.Author: PAspoon
Reviews.Content: I work in the resort industry and have been highly critical of my own workplace's persistent "4 star" rating. My small family was looking forward to a fun weekend in Charm City. Booked this room through hotwire. The room was extremely small with no fridge, no microwave and a tv that received only 6 channels. The two pluses were the location of the hotel and its cleanliness. Asked if we could upgrade, supposedly none were available. Yet the parking garage was practically empty. Traveling with a young toddler, needed to warm up milk twice a day. This was problematic. The superficial niceness of the front desk wore off whenever I needed something and was given a basic I can't help you with that response. I think had the service been up to par it would have made up for the hotel's lack of common amenities (i.e. standing shower but no tub, lack of space, etc.). All in all the room wasn't horrific but no way would I pay their rack rate ($459 a night) or even the discounted hotwire rate (basically 50% off) for a hotel experience worse than a Motel 6

Reviews.Title: “Internet is important”
Reviews.Author: Swl781
Reviews.Content: Hotels seem to undervalue the need for Internet access. We travel with an iPad and a laptop, and use them for different projects, and rarely at the same time. This hotel charges $13 per night and insisted that it is "Sheraton policy" that it be charged per machine, not per room. There is no free wifi in the lobby, only four computers that can be used, if available. The manager very reluctantly waived our second charge the first night. Not very smart for an expensive hotel in a struggling area

Reviews.Title: “NOT good enough”
Reviews.Author: mgjewishgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Yankee/Orioles game (one night). Got the room through Priceline.com for less than half of the hotel's price. Not worth the $ I spent at all! The room was small, the carpet was stained, there were stains on the bathroom wall and the glass shelves in the room were dusty and the bed squeeked. The TV stopped working at 2am and i had to mess with the plugs to get it to work again. The blue rugs heading to the South Tower elevators was musty. Perhaps the Priceline customers get the older, dirtier rooms? Once leaving the hotel walk with crowds..one wrong turn and there are dozens of beggars and "low brow" people. A bottle of soda in the shop in the lobby is $2.. At 2am, I had a blistering headache and no help from the hotel staff other than to send me to a 7-11 in the neighborhood- I stayed put. There was a nice view of the stadium but thats the only ammenity in this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay...Would Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: cr8tvgrl
Reviews.Content: It's about 10 minutes walking distance from the Orioles Baseball Park and the Inner Harbor, but it's still a wonderful place to stay. Also, you dodge the higher priced hotels due its location away from the major attractions. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. We all raved about the beds in the rooms, which were quite comfortable. I'm unsure of what other reviewers referred to as "urban blight" as you are surrounded by office and retail establishments...really just typical city buildings. If you want a view of the harbor or higher end shopping establishments you'll definitely have to stay in the Inner Harbor area, but it will definitely cost you! It's not really worth it considering the hotel is for sleeping and you can easily walk to many tourist attractions. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed the way it ended”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading some positive Tripadviser reviews despite its low ranking. I felt all the staff at this hotel initially went out of their way to make my stay at their hotel special. From the moment I checked in, the staff did more than I would expect at any hotel. They offered me a welcome basket while upgrading me. And they would call me asking if there was anything they could do. I ordered room service and they gave me a free fruit plate. I was aware the rooms do not have a bathtub, but I was surprised how big the shower was. Also there was no fridge, but the ice machine was right outside my door. On the 2nd day of my stay, I discovered the upgrade I got wasn't that good. The room was connected to rooms on my left and right, and there was a noisy family on my left. They were so loud it was like them being in the same room with me. I am basically a quiet person. They can't hear me but I can hear them. I know I did not pay for the rooms on my sides, but even the front desk girl who checked me in later acknowledged that yes, one of the negatives of my upgraded room is that is connected to 2 other rooms. I just got the feeling that the hotel wasn't exactly fully occupied, so it's not like they could not have left the room next to me vacant. If I had to choose between an upgrade and a room not connected to another room, I would always pick the latter, since I have had bad experiences with connected rooms. But since I got used to the upgraded room and wasn't staying long, I did not ask for another room. I personally don't understand why they have connected rooms. If a family wants to stay in a hotel, why not just book a suite, why have connected rooms? I must say I am disappointed it had to end this way. I guess it was too good to be true, that I was given a wonderful room for one day, and that I couldn't have a 2nd good day. But hotels are always like that. They go out of their way to cater to you, then they do something stupid to ruin your stay. I doubt I'll be staying here again, upgrade or not. There are just too many new and good hotels in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS! FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: thebee
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Baltimore City Center is a FABULOUS city hotel. Recently renovated, the rooms are crisp, very clean and comfortable. They are a "normal" big city size (much larger than NYC rooms and about the size of Chicago rooms) and beautifully styled. Flat screen TV, bright clean bathroom with a pedestal sink. Price point is excellent..much better than the Inner Harbor hotels which are overpriced. What makes this hotel even more OUTSTANDING is the STAFF. From the minute I walked in the door until I left on the shuttle, the staff greeted me and took care of my EVERY need. I don't think I have ever stayed in a hotel that had staff that cared so much for their patrons...from the front desk to the housekeeping staff, I felt completely taken care of! The food in Shulas2 was EXCELLENT, I ate there for SuperBowl Sunday, breakfast and lunch for the next two days. Wonderful food and wonderful service..highly recommend. I have read other reviews about the neighborhood and I was a little worried but, NO NEED! I felt completely safe. I walked to the Basilica and to some of the historic sites near the FREE Art Museum and had no fears. It is a wonderful, short 5 -7 minute walk to the Inner Harbor and tons of shopping and again, I felt completely safe. There are a few shady areas about 4 blocks from the hotel but...THIS IS A BIG CITY PEOPLE..no different than Chicago, NYC, Dallas or any other big city. Lots of things to do and see nearby. I will return in June for a conference and I cannot wait to see how exciting this area is when it comes alive for the summer! I know that I will be well taken care of in the Sheraton Baltimore City Center.I highly recommend the Sheraton Baltimore City Center, it is a fabulously priced, quality hotel. Kudos to the following staff: Wesley Peskin, Pat Palmere, Alesia (at the desk)..Thank you for a wonderful stay! If you are hesitating, don't ...BOOK THIS HOTEL, you will not be disappointed. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good thing the staff was friendly...”
Reviews.Author: smep013
Reviews.Content: Not many positives on this one. It was the site of meetings for work, so I had no choice in the matter. The hotel's location does not do the city of Baltimore justice. Sure, it's a 10 minute walk rom the Inner Harbor, but it's surrounded by urban blight. Aside from the arena, the area is not very lively. Old, boarded up buildings and lack of restaurants. Starbucks is a 10-minute walk. The Shulas onsite is not very good. Rooms are old and fixtures were missing (no bathroom door hook). There was also a convention going on IN the lobby, so had to walk through that to get to the elevator. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than ratings suggest”
Reviews.Author: eddotcom
Reviews.Content: We bid for this hotel on Priceline and were not expecting much after reading some of the TripAdvisor reviews for our purchase. We were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean and fresh (renovation couldn't have been that long ago). The room was not large by American standards, but was quite adequate. It has a very large uncluttered desk with a flat panel television. They even addressed two of my pet peeves suggesting that someone might have read my previous reviews: The bed was made without the top sheet and bedding tucked in--allowing one to get into bed without pulling the under-sheet loose. The labels on the shampoo and other bottles were huge so that those of us requiring glasses need not fear the inadvertent application of hand lotion to the hair. Some reviews made note of a dangerous neighborhood. This was not our experience at all. We walked several blocks immediately after dark one evening and felt safe--even the Deadheads outside the adjacent arena were more happy than threatening. If you do not want to pay the hotel's parking charge, a public parking directly across from the hotel entrance charges only $7.75 overnight.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: happytravels1213
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed there for a business trip and the hotel is very clean which is my #1priority other than location. The reason I'm mainly writing this review is to say thank you to the staff because my fiance and I both forgot our coats in the closet of our hotel room. I realized this after we were already 2 hours driving back to New York so I called the hotel and they said they'd check to find out if our coats were still there. I got a phone call back right away saying they had them and they told me they would ship them free of charge back to us. I got the coats via UPS 3days later.!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice older hotel; excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Hotels, including the Sheraton, closer to the harbor area, were so expensive we chose this less expensive hotel, but, based on reviews we saw, opted to pay the extra to get a Club-level room. We booked directly online. After I had trouble contacting the hotel to request this upgrade (e-mails to the hotel bounced back), I sent a message to the main Sheraton site, and a representative of the hotel wrote to me, saying we'd be given an upgrade at no charge. And the room-- a corner room on the highest floor-- was great. Bathroom was small, but the room itself was spacious and comfortable. Since we were using the Johns Hopkins Hospital rate (we both had appointments there), we got free Wi-Fi. Also were given access to the club lounge, where there were free evening snacks and continental breakfast, and drinks for sale in the evening (and a computer with a printer). I understood the person at the front desk to say that not all club-level rooms had access to the club, but am not sure about this. Parking is pricey. Self-parking is around the corner. We opted for valet parkng both nights, at $29 (it's higher on Fridays and maybe Saturdays). We walked to the Inner Harbor, about 10 minutes away, and felt safe, though we did do this in the early evening. Also walked to nearby Walgreens and Citibank. Service by the valets, bell captain and others was quite good. We would not hestiate to return, at least for a Club-level room. Heard some minor traffic noise once rush hour started.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy baby YEAH!”
Reviews.Author: thame_hoops
Reviews.Content: i got a rate of around $80 a night via ebookers when i booked a hotel and flight package from the UK Before i arrived i emailed the hotel and asked to be placed on a higher floor. Samantha schultz duly obliged and when i checked in, not only was i on the 20th floor (out of 23) but she had upgraded me to a corner room with a fantastic 190 degree, panoramic view of the city. The room was large, i did see another king room that was half the size so i guess its luck of the drawer? Clean, nicely decorated, some slight wear to the walls and bathroom but nothing too noticeable. the maid was excellant, left me fresh starbucks coffee for my machine and bottles of water. TV is a nice 32 inch LCD, Lobby staff are friendly, it did get busy with conferences but it didnt bother me. Location is great, a block from charles st and a 5 min brisk walk to the inner harbour. i felt safe as there were always doormen around even at 2am. A taxi rank is right next door so its never a problem hailing a cab. Didnt eat at shula's it looked expensive, i did go to the bar which was good but drinks were dearer than the local bars. i found it nicer to head up to o'sheas on charles st, the service there is fantasic. Its a shame they charge you for wifi, most hotels have this free now but i paid $39 for 7 days access and it was very fast and reliable. i have no hesitation recommending this hotel, id stay here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “I was Extremely Surprised and Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: guffin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in major hotels around the world and truthfully was not expecting much from an older down town Baltimore hotel. I was totally wrong. We came for two days for the Baltimore Marathon (I was not a runner only grand kids watcher) and we were met upon arrival by Cliff Carrol ,who instantly put us number one on his priority list. He was friendly,considerate and extremely helpful. He handled the baggage, retrieved ice for the room and he even checked with a trendy restaurant for us to arrange shuttle transfer and reservations ---for nine of us in three rooms. What service!!!! There was a mix up thanks to family misinterpretation of rooms needed and the front desk was extremely patient with us to straighten the problem out. They did this with a friendly manner in a stressful environment and should be applauded for there fine and successful efforts. The rooms turned out to be end rooms in the South Tower and were perfect for the families involved. The rate of $115 with two breakfast buffet slips per nights stay which I thought excellent for room size and hotel location not far from the Inner Harbor. There is a $29 parking fee-we stayed two nights and were only charged once for this. The breakfast buffet at Shula 2 near the lobby was outstanding for both kids and adults with friendly service,good food and pleasant surroundings. $13 was very reasonable and we had the slips for two which helped with cost. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again--and hope to :-)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: navywrslr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Sheraton for the Baltimore Marathon. The location was perfect,walking distance to all the venues. The staff was very friendly,the room was nice and large with a great bed. Parking was in a large garage under the hotel,and once I parked,I did not need to use the car. The area around the hotel was safe to walk in,which is nice for a large city. Shula 2,the restaurant located in the hotel served great food,the Meat Loaf Sandwich was the best I ever had,and was HUGH.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MAndy072010
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very helpful and professional. The walk was about 5 blocks from the Inner Harbor. The rooms were a little small, but clean and comfortable. The hotel was attractive and clean in general. The only thing i didn't like was that my room was not ready when I arrived and i had to wait an hour or so to get into it (and it was in the afternoon/early evening when I arrived).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the price”
Reviews.Author: cclynn427
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a recent visit to Baltimore and stayed at the Sheraton City Center. The hotel is nice, with a newly renovated lobby and rooms. We arrived on a Friday afternoon before check in and were able to get in right away. The room was a standard with a queen sized bed. It was a little small, but enough room for my husband and I. The bathroon was bright and clean, but tiny. There was no tub, only a shower, that we both felt was like a college dorm, but cleaner. As for the service, the staff was amazing. Very friendly and eager to help. Our flight home on Sunday was not until the evening and the bell service stored our luggage after we checked out for no additional charge. Hotel is very close to every where you'd want to be in the inner harber. Although the city can get a little questionable at night, we were fine. We were able to walk to the inner harbor, shops, water taxi, and attractions within 10mins. Great stay. I would only caution visitors to stay away from Lexington Market. It appears on many attraction lists, but is very scary. We walked there for breakfast as we had heard it had a lot of great food, but were surprised to see many people who seemed to be on drugs. Clearly, some were high and talking to themselves or screaming at others. We even saw one lady being dragged out by security and spitting all over. We didn't even stay long enough to eat! With so many great places in and around the harbor, you can avoid Lexington Market!

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravlr52
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel from the available properties which we're offered up for a convention my wife and I we're attending in Baltimore. It was one of the more moderately priced options in the selection, so I decided to give it a try. Stayed there three nights and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is ok with respect to access to the convention center and the inner harbor (if you don't mind the pan handlers), however, the hotel itself is old, rundown and in desperate need of a remodel. The hallways are dingy and dark, and the room didn't even have a lounge chair......either you sit at the desk or on the bed. As for the elevator, it was always crowded and utterly filthy, with no evidence of regular cleaning.......and this is significant because I had to use the elevator frequently to get my room key card reprogramed when it failed to work (and yes I kept it away from my cell phone and all magnetic devices). Lastly, there was the parking. The hotel lot was full, so I learned that I could either use the valet (@$35.00 a night) or park it in a nearby lot. Naturally, I chose the self park option ($ 19) and upon checkout , found that the hotel erroneously billed me for valet! I could go on, but what is the point?......caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: brepri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the farthest from the Inner Harbor out of all the hotels, although it was certainly within walking distance and was not too far in my opinion. If you were to take a right out of the hotel there is a coffee shop and a walgreens just a couple blocks down which was very convenient. The decor in the hotel was very nice as they have recently renovated, although my room was one that had not been yet. We kept hearing about these super comfy beds they have but we didn't get one, ours was stiff. Overall it was a nice hotel, not awesome, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: stryych9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend series of Yankee games at Camden Yards and to go to the National Aquarium. The hotel is only a 1/2 mile walk to the game and about 3/4 mile to the Aquarium. We got the rooms through Hotwire and were a little skeptical about the area after reading some other reviews and watching 'The Wire', but at no time did we feel unsafe. We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel and rooms and really enjoyed our stay. Tony's Diner across the street had slow service but the price was good and the food was worth waiting for. There is a Gyro truck that parks one block south of the hotel on the west side of the hotel which is AWESOME. My only complaints about the hotel were the late night noise from neighboring bars and clubs and the constant police and fire engine sirens. I slept through it all but my father got woken up 5 times a night. The fire and police station is only 2 blocks away so you hear the sirens on every call. If you're a light sleeper you may want to ask for a room on one of the upper floors or on the inside. The pool was too cold to swim in (understandable for september) and it does not get a lot of sunlight. probably only from 2 to 4 pm because of the shadows of the hotel and the neighboring buildings. The staff was very courteous and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure our stay was terrific and made sure we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag! Gotta get a deal to balance out pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 2 night stay for a baseball game at Camden yard and booked our room through hotwire for a great rate. Pros: The bed was very comfortable for both my wife and I. The fitness center was larger than most I've been in with plenty of equipment. Checkin was very quick with front desk very helpful. Our room was clean and check out was very quick. Cons: The room didn't have a safe or a mini fridge. The absence of the safe being way more important. They did offer a safe deposit box downstairs but we didn't use it. The hotel location at night definately has the criminal element. I'm a police officer in another city and I felt uncomfortable at night but I did see police presence so that was good. I joked with my wife that when we were walking around the harbor i felt like we were on vacation but when we got back around the hotel I felt like I was on duty. No free wifi. Additional Info: We read previous reviews about parking so we didn't bother with valet or self park with hotel. The first night we paid $18.00 for 24 hrs. in the garage that runs underground. The second night we moved our car to another garage on Baltimore ave. for $12.00 for 24 hours. Previous reviewers mentioned cheaper options for parking but they neglected to mention where exactly these places are.The garage we used was on Baltimore between N. Liberty and N. Howard Streets Summary: If you get a great rate and don't need a room safe, free wifi or a mini-fridge and don't don't mind the location then you will be just fine here. If you spend more than $75 a night then I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience I've had in a Baltimore hotel! Been visiting for 3 years”
Reviews.Author: laineylains
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting Baltimore annually since 2007. I've stayed this hotel while it was the Wyndham (which was, btw my worst hotel experience in my life), and various other hotels in the area. I returned to this location as it became the Sheraton, and I had an amazing deal of $99/night which is a rate that the staff were shocked that I got! The rooms are lovely and clean. What impressed me most were the staff. Specifically there was a man who helped arrange for my parcels to be brought up to my room. It took awhile, so he waived most of the charges for shipping parcels to the hotel. On the final day, they messed up my checkout bill (I was charged valet parking and don't even have a car), the same man was on shift and he came to the front desk with me and helped clear all the funny charges on my bill. And every day, I was happily greeted with smiling faces by all of the staff. Whenever I asked for additional blankets and towels, the staff were extremely helpful. This had to have been my best hotel experience and I frequently stay at hotels. I was very impressed, especially with the terrible experience I had at this location when it was formerly the Wyndham. The area though, mind you is a bit unsafe. But this goes for all of the Baltimore downtown city core.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: H20lvr
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to Camden Yards, Inner Harbor and Lexington Market. All common areas were clean. Had a room in the south tower, 14th floor, which had a great view. King room was clean, plenty of closet and drawer space, however the bathroom was on the small side, but for the price we got on Hotwire it could be overlooked. All the staff we encounter in the hotel were, friendly and helpful. Not sure about the other reviewers not feeling safe. Yes, being Caucasian, you are in the minority, but that should not stop you from seeing the City. We walked everywhere, up Charles St. to Maisey’s for Dinner, down to the Inner Harbor, Fells Point and over to the Lexington Market. Everyone was friendly, we never encountered any panhandlers and the Lexington Market is a most if you are a foodie. Very enjoyable stay and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “central Location convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: Aniguan
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, exceptional service at the front desk, clean and easy to use fitness center, parking across the street for $8 instead of the hotel's higher fee. I especially liked the urban location and the walking distance to inner harbor, inner harbor east and federal hill.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bethannc524
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and staff was nice. However, LARGE convention all weekend. If I was informed that the hotel was going to be 90% convention people I would have stayed elsewhere. The convention attendees were up all night going all through the floors. Lobby was continuously packed with convention attendees as they were selling their different items. The attendees were the most obnoxious people I have ever met. Loud, rude, pushed, barged in front of you to get to an elevator, people. The parking garage was designed by a moron. People were parked where they were not suppose to park. We almost got hit trying to exit the lot. When I approached the parking lot attendant and asked if they checked the garage for vehicles in towaway zones, her reply as "NO". Why have towaway zones or DO NOT PARK ALONG RAMP signs when they allow it anyway? Also pets are allowed and a dog barked continuously on our floor. We will NEVER stay at this Sheraton again and I highly recommend you do not waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a getaway....”
Reviews.Author: shaq78
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the area with my husband for a wknd getaway (Fathers Day Weekend). Hotel was great, clean and hotel staff was professional and accomodating. Guestroom and hotel was clean. Perfect location, close to the inner harbor, restaurants and attractions. Only complaint was the parking situation which was a nightmare, but the hotel mngr gave us a full refund and was understanding. (we paid for parking in the hotel garage and when we used the in/out garage privileges, the garage was full, after we paid for it). Very quiet hotel, although this particular wknd, there was a vendor show.exhibition which was nice. Another downer to the weekend was the "locals" couldn't recommend a good restaurant to eat at, specifically for seafood. We did visit Mo's which was a recommended restaurant and had a horrible experience with a dirty table, dirty utensils and dirt in our drinkng water. In addition to the poor staff and mngr at the restaurant. We quickly left without eating. Otherwise, a great location for a relaxing weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Hair on bed sheets, $28 per day to park, puke in lobby, blood stain on bathroom door; would'nt recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Nik_Chic_PA
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a $99 per day special and was not worth my one night stay. Although it was conveniently located near the Harbor, was low on noise (if on the upper floors) and had good service, I have nothing else nice to say about it. I lifted my pillow to find hairs on the sheet and the bathroom door was filthy; one stain looked like blood. You could tell this was a very old hotel that hasn't ever been remodled. Someone vomitted in the lobby all the way to the elevator and this remained there until my son slipped in it! For all of this, I did get a free breakfast; not even close to worth it.

Reviews.Title: “stay closer to harbor”
Reviews.Author: bigceiling
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs many updates. Rooms are decent and fairly well appointed but the exterior is down right delapated. Outside the hotel there is no where to walk that feels safe. There are panhandlers everywhere and some are quite aggresive! I cant use some of the words that were tossed my way. If you have children or are traveling alone think twice about staying here!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: cwsfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for a downtown hotel and it is within walking distance of the Inner Harbor area, 1st Mariner Arena, Camden Yards (Orioles) and M&T Bank Stadium (Ravens). It is close enough to everything but not right on top of everything that may disrupt a good night's sleep. It was also in a safe area and we didn't not feel unsafe even at night. The rooms were a good size and had all the amenities you needed including a full sized hairdryer which the ladies will appreciate. The staff at the hotel were always polite and extremely helpful. I had several questions about the services at the hotel and they were able to answer them quickly and professionally. The only downside to the rooms is that the walls/doors were a little on the thin side as we could hear the neighbors come in and out. We had an adjoining room so this may have accented the problem. Just something to be mindful of. The hotel had pretty much all the amenities you would expect at a 3 star downtown hotel. We didn't use the fitness center so I don't know how good it was but everything in the hotel was clean and well maintained. If you plan to use the swimming pool you will need to do it early as it closes at 8pm. This was a little disappointing for us but by no means a deal breaker. As with any downtown hotel in a metropolitan area there are parking charges for guests. The hotel has a parking garage but if you want to save some money use the parking garage across the street from the main lobby. To access the garage you will go down the ramp in the middle of Fayette street (it is almost right in front of the hotel). On weekends it is only $10 per day compared to the $19+ the hotel will charge. As other reviewers have mentioned there is a little diner across the street from the hotel called Tony's Diner. I would advise you to avoid this little gem. We left 15 minutes after being seated and not even getting our drinks. The staff there paid no attention to us and probably didn't even notice we had left. The sad part is that they had 2 waitresses and only 7 tables with patrons so it wasn't like they were terribly busy. There are alternatives nearby so you won't go hungry. About 300 feet from the hotel's front door is a Burger King and there is a Dunkin Donuts and a 7-11 a block away on the corner of Baltimore and S Howard Street (on the other side of 1st Mariner Arena). If none of these suits you then you can eat at the hotel's restaurants or go to the inner harbor. In summary I was happy with my stay at the Sheraton. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this to anyone visiting the downtown Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “you could not PAY me to stay at the sheraton again.”
Reviews.Author: ragamuffinz
Reviews.Content: the sheraton inner city hotel in baltimore, maryland was by far the WORST hotel experience i have had in my life. i am currently typing this in my room, i am staying here from 7/29 to 8/2. the staff was friendly for the first two days, everything was fine. the hotel is absolutely beautiful and i couldn't ask for better price on the room. however, during this entire weekend, me and my roommates' keys were constantly de-activated multiple times throughout the day. the first day was ok, maybe there was a glitch in the system so i thought nothing of it. i heard all of my roommates' keys were not working as well, and it seemed to be a problem. getting new room keys was a huge hassle; there was a small interrogation process before aquiring the new key every time i needed one. ID was also needed, and was a big problem when i had to go downstairs for a small emergency at 2 am with nothing but pajamas, flip flops, and a de-activated key. after 7 deactivated room keys, i became terribly frustrated to the point i could no longer muster up a polite facade for the front desk. it seemed like every time i needed to get into my room, i needed to report to the front desk to ask for a key, much like a small child asking the permissions of his parents. as an adult, i find this process highly unneccesary and a great hassle. i was reminded time and time again i should not keep my hotel room key near my credit cards, cell phone(s), any electronic devices, any metal objects, and PENS. the employees also blamed the baltimore convention center for de-activating my keys, which could very well be the case. but if it were the case, then why didn't everyone who was staying here and went into the convention center have key problems? why didn't 30,000 more people have this problem who all stepped foot into the convention center have key problems? and.... pens? cell phones and electronic devices are understandable, but pens and metal objects? are your keys really so sensitive to tiny pieces of metal with barely any magnetism to be deactivated SEVEN TIMES by the metal of the ball point pen in my bag? nonsense. i have traveled all over the world and stayed in various hotels, visit baltimore yearly and have stayed in every hotel in the inner harbor with the exception of the hyatt and the intercontinental, and i have NEVER had this problem before. not only that, when i attempted to illustrate how far away i keep my keys from my cellphone and credit cards, i had a glass object in the bottom of my nylon bag. i put the bag down a bit too hard on the counter (my fault) and the glass hit the marble, making a loud "clink"-ing sound. a nearby gust services employee stepped between the me and the employee i was speaking with, and told me to leave the premises because i was being violent by "slamming" my bag into the counter and was going to call security. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?????? if that was a joke, it was not funny at all. never have i EVER experienced something like this before. it is utterly ridiculous! what terrible service, and accusing me of violence because something in my bag hit the counter and made a loud sound. after the ordeal, i was further interrogated to make sure i i didn't put my keys in xyz place which MAY have de-activated it, etc. may i remind you this is the 7th time i had to go through this. the hotel should really have a file on who has bad room keys or a broken sensor/lock on the door. it would be so much easier than having to waste 5-10 minutes every time i need to re-enter my room. i felt the hotel was very disorganized in this aspect, and i really did not appreciate having to go through that, therefore i will not stay at the sheraton again by my own free will. in plain speak bullets for your ease of reading a re-cap: -i feel like i was treated like a prisoner, a child, a retard, and generally sh*t all around. -i have one more night in this room and i really do hope my hotel keys will not de-activate before i check out tomorrow afternoon. - the sheraton will never be a choice in hotels for me again - i have no desire to pay for a room which i am unable to access for the duration of my stay - i am so glad i am not paying the full price for this room because $500/night is so not worth the money to be going through this. - the price that i am paying for this room is STILL not worth going through what i have gone through during my stay. i could pay much less to stay at a motel and get better courtesy and service than i got at the SHERATON.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!!”
Reviews.Author: Rondo_MA
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotline ($69/night) and then checked here to see reviews. I was prepared for a less-than-perfect experience after reading a variety of negative comments here. To my surprise, everything was excellent! My husband and I had our 11 year old great-nephew with us, and we were in Baltimore for 2 nights (Mon & Tues) to visit the Inner Harbor. We were upgraded (without asking) to a corner room, and we're NOT Starwood members. Our room was in the North Tower, on the 2nd floor, so there was no view; both the room and the bathroom were average size. We had a king bed, and the rollaway we requested for our great-nephew was brought immediately to our room, within minutes. The staff was exceptionally friendly and courteous. The front desk called our room a few hours after we checked in to make sure everything was to our liking and to see if we needed anything. We received a second call from Housekeeping to make sure the rollaway bed had been delivered. All the staff we dealt with were particularly friendly and helpful, every staff person we passed greeted us warmly - it made me wonder if there was a campaign in place to counter some of the negative staff comments that had been left here. Our bed was fabulously comfortable! The room was quiet and clean, and the decor was fine The pool was a bit small, but otherwise okay. Because of positive reviews left here, we ate breakfast the first morning at Tony's, the nearby diner, but all 3 of us thought the food was awful. It's convenient, and cheap, but the eggs, bacon and pancakes were all lousy. Maybe lunch and dinner is better. Inner Harbor is a 10 minute walk through downtown. At night the area had a lof of inner city folks hanging out on the streets - we're city dwellers, so it didn't bother us, but if you're not used to that you might want to take a cab back from Inner Harbor at night. Check out the free 'Charm City Circulator' bus to get to popular areas - there's a bus stop for the free bus on Fayette St, close to the hotel. The Visitor Center located at Inner Harbor is a gold mine of information - be sure to talk to the staff instead of just picking up brochures, the staff there was awesome, gave us loads of helpful information. We were delighted to have gotten such a nice hotel for $69 a night; my only complaint about the hotel is the cost of parking - their garage was $24 a night (plus $4.80 tax!) We should have driven around a bit looking for cheaper garages, but we opted (and paid for!) for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great price but let down by poky rooms and disorganization”
Reviews.Author: jdw1982
Reviews.Content: We were a party of eight who had booked four rooms: when we arrived at 2pm we were told that only one room was available at that stage, but that the rest should be within half an hour. Come 4pm three of the four rooms were available, but even at 5pm (at which point we left to watch the Orioles lose to the Bluejays) the final room was not available. The desk staff seemed harrassed and somewhat unfriendly (we were not the only ones unable to check in, they seemed to have a lobby full of guests with no rooms long after the advertised check-in time), although they did provide us with vouchers for complimentary appetizers. The saving grace was that when we returned from our evening out at around 2am (the room was finally ready by then!) the night staff on the desk could not have been more friendly, apologetic or helpful, and gave us a significant discount on what was already a very reasonable room rate. As for the room itself - very clean and perfectly adequate for sleeping in, but pretty small and with very iffy soundproofing. We noticed from the Camden Yards stadium that the bulb in the letter "n" of "Sheraton" on the side of the building had burned out, which rather sums up the place really...

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just fine”
Reviews.Author: VyVy60
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton City Center in Baltimore for 3 nights on business, in July 2010. After reading prior reviews, I expected much worse. It was a typical business-class hotel in a downtown area, nothing more, nothing less. I was upgraded to a corner room--nice to have windows out 2 sides--by being in the Starwood Club, which is free. They told me a refrigerator could be supplied at an additional cost of $20 per night, which I found ridiculous. The gym was good, two rooms full of lots of cardio equipment and limited weights and machines, but the major problem there was the temperature. The place was like an oven, and on my final day there, the water coolers were both empty. Staff brought in water bottles, but they disappeared quickly. The pool was small but popular. Head bellhop was VERY helpful with directions, and all staff were very courteous. Not sure why prior guests seem to have had issues--either those staff members have been replaced, or maybe those guests had issues of their own. Not enough hangers in the closet (6), but a nicely upgraded (albeit small) bathroom. Huge king bed, and not much street noise (I was on the 9th floor). A good-size desk and TV. Yes, everything was dated in decor, but when traveling on business, that doesn't really matter, does it? THE BEST PART was the gyro stand on the corner. Exit the front of the hotel, turn left at the end of the block (which is actually right there), go to the next corner and it is across the street. Literally a two-minute walk, and this is some of the BEST street food I have ever had (and I've had street food in Beijing, Hong Kong, Bangkok, Guadalajara, Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City, Chiang Mai...you get the picture) . You get a huge lamb gyro (with or without hot sauce--if you like spicy, get it!) for $4, or $4.85 with a can of soda. Best deal in town and outrageously good. I took 3 gyros home, and would almost go back to Baltimore just for them! The hotel was fine and certainly not deserving of the negative remarks of the kind in some other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: smashthings
Reviews.Content: Rooftop Pool and Gym were amazing! Excellent Staff and Valet. Rooms were kinda plain Jane and A/C wasnt quite to where it shouldve been being that hot out.... Not too bad tho...

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: nb1685
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and came here to read the reviews once I learned where I would be staying. After seeing some of the less than stellar reviews here, I was a little worried about what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised! True, it's not a brand new hotel, so there is some wear. However, nothing stood out to me as being horrible or dirty like some other reviewers claimed. I did have one issue - when we got to our room, the light in the hall was out, so it was a little creepy. We went out to grab some water and reported it to the front desk on the way. We were back at the hotel less than a half hour later and they had already sent someone to fix the light. All of the employees that I had any contact with were very friendly and helpful and the room was decent. Nothing super fancy, but clean. The hotel was within walking distance of the inner harbor, or a pretty cheap cab ride if you were tired from walking all day. I might have liked to stay directly at the harbor, but for the price, this location was great. Also, as another reviewer commented, Tony's Diner (right across the street) was a find! Looks like a dive from the outside, but was very nice inside with great food and some of the nicest servers I dealt with my entire time in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to 1st Mariners Arena and a short walk to the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: somerssalt
Reviews.Content: We were going to see American Idol at 1st Mariners Arena so thought we'd make it a little more special and book a room for the night even though it's less than an hour from our home. This Sheraton was the logical choice since the buildings are on opposite corners of the same intersection. The staff was very efficient and well-trained here. They called after I got in the room to see if I liked it. My wife called them twice in the morning to get some additional toiletries and coffee supplies and the service was immediate and very friendly. The room was comfortable and clean. The pool was large and was real nice: it's oudoors and was the perfect refreshing temperature and had a life guard- it's open 9am to 8:30 pm. In-room Internet was an extra $12.50 and it worked great. I was offered Valet parking for about $35 (I said no thanks) and they said their self-parking lot was full. The valet parking gentleman told me to park in the underground lot right across the street and it was only $7.75 per day (but it is a little more on weekdays). The room had a nice new flat screen tv hanging on the wall. I was on the 21st floor of the North tower and it was beautiful absolute silence- no road noise and no noise from other rooms. The matresses and bed linens were very comfortable. I didn't eat in the restaurant or order room service. So everything was great as far as I was concerned. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't be a first choice”
Reviews.Author: Grovemontjanet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. The lobby was nicely done with a very helpful conciege and front desk staff. However, the rest of the hotel , including meeting rooms, is badly in need of renovation. My room was large enough but run-down with stained carpet and dirty mildewed bathroom. There was nothing special or extra except a coffee maker and hairdryer. Street noise was a problem for sleeping. The Inner Harbor area is about five blocks away and Camden Yards is within walking distance, but it's best to go with a group or in a cab for safety.

Reviews.Title: “Common Areas Need Improvement”
Reviews.Author: trvlpepl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit worn around the edges. The lobby and hallways were not the cleanest and the parking garage smelled badly. Granted, parking garages never smell great but this one really smelled bad. The common areas looked like they could use a good vacuuming and the carpet needed a thorough cleaning. The room was ok and the location of the hotel is well within walking distance of the inner harbor. However, I probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: AweSumThenSum
Reviews.Content: From our 2 a.m. Saturday check in until our late checkout on Monday, we had a fantastic experience at this hotel. The staff was courteous and cheerful, and extremely helpful. The pool was refreshing, but not heated and located in a spot that doesn't get much sun. Inner Harbor is approximately a 10 minute walk, and the hotel is close to the convention center and sports arenas.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, very good location!”
Reviews.Author: louise71594
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the negative reviews here, we had no problems with this hotel. We checked in on July 2nd for 1 night. Check in was quick and we were upgraded to a corner deluxe king room, (comes with being a starwoods preferred guest), and that was a nice treat without having to ask for it. The room was pretty decent ie; nice comfortable king bed, fairly decorated, small but adequate bathroom (no tub), and air-condiitoning was great, especially with it being in the high 80's that day. We did spend some time at the pool, nothing fancy, but very spacious and plenty of lounge chairs. The parking is a bit expensive, but that was to be expected and they added the parking fee to our bill, which was a plus, so for $137.00 including parking for the night, not bad. Staying on the harbor would have easily been about $75 - $100 more. The location was perfect for us ie; 3 blocks from the harbor, within walking distance to convenience stores, and a nice little diner and bar across the street name "Tony's!!! The bartender Rob will make you some killer drinks, and we ate breakfast their the next morning. The meal was pretty good for $4.99, that included, 2 eggs, home fries, toast and your choice of meat. My hubby had Begian waffle, home fries, and meat for about $2.00 more. Some people complained about the downtown location, but it was typical of any urban downtown location. Locals and tourists were walking about. We are from a big city, and I work in the city, and for it to have been a Saturday, night, it was actually pretty quiet, until you got to the Harbor. We never thought twice about anything bad happenening, and their were cops walking the beat. For a quick overnight getaway, this hotel fit the bill. Most of our time was spent at the harbor, with under two hours spent at the hotel pool. Overall, we enjoyed our overnight stay, I rated the service 3 stars only because we really did not have to use it for anything, except to check in and out... We are looking forward to returning before the summer is over.

Reviews.Title: “Felt low rent - needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFrancophile
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't completely appalling but it definitely needs some maintenance, at the very minimum. The halls were very dimly lit which made it feel dingy to me. There were chips in the tub and some of the wallpaper in the hallway was torn away and frayed. The lobby was okay but it was on the small side so there was no sitting area. The room wasn't very nice either (stains on the carpet and a broken lampshade). Honestly it felt more like a room at a budget chain hotel than a big city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if would stay again”
Reviews.Author: gt_a_lif
Reviews.Content: Even as a Platinum member, i am not sure i would stay here again. The lobby is nicely done, the staff was extremely friendly but the rooms are the smallest room I have seen in a long time, and i was upgraded. The bathroom, although nicely stocked, barely fits the sink, WC and SOT. You cannot sit at the desk and work and see the TV. And the neighborhood is a bit sketchy. The Lounge was about 100 degrees, the selection was tired and when I opened the hot food, the steam burned my hand. Not the best Sheraton I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for just one night”
Reviews.Author: BON3S
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the early after and was told that the room wouldn't be available but if we were a Starwood member it would of been get that so there was a room but not for me. After spending time walking down to the harbour and looking around and then having some lunch we went back to the hotel and the room was available. The hotel room was in the North Tower of the hotel the room was on the 16th floor and it wasn't to bad except the bathroom was so small even a newborn baby couldn't fit in there. After this in the evening we went down to the fitness centre but it was extremely cold to bad if you wanted to sweat to bad you were more likely to get frost bite not sweat drips. The pool was alright except the lifeguard couldn't speak english to bad if you needed help. Overall the hotel was alright I would only recommend it for one night. Around $30 to get to BWI airport from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good locatoin with questionable staff”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights week of June 7th. Stayed in 2314 in the north tower. Check in went fine as it turns out because i arrived late in the evening. The rooms are on the small side and the bathroom is the size of a coat closet. The concierge lounge on the 22nd floor is spacious however the espresso machine has been broken for several months according to the staff. Well it look nice sitting in the middle of beverage area. While the hotel is not on the water its a 5 minute walk to the harbour downhill. The hotel is also close to camden yard and the blue line train which runs from BWI. Tried twice to eat at Shula's 2 in the lobby, seating wasn't a problem but the service or lack there of was. The first time after 10 minutes of not being greeted i packed it up and hit one of the local establishments for dinner. On the 2nd try i was actually acknowledged but it was still terribly slow. Time to check out and the bill is wrong, charged for the internet ( free if your platinum), quick call to the desk and they apologized and said to stop by for an updated copy. Stopped by at 7:30 and the charge was removed however now there is a mysterious $50 charge under the "other" column. Front desk clerk couldn't figure it out so they said to stop by before i headed to the airport. Get back at 10:30 and the line is 8 deep at the desk with 2 people actually handling the guest and 3 other managers/desk staff roaming the lobby not to concerned about the wait. Of course the Platinum/Gold desk was empty as well. Based on the comments of other guest in line it seems several people had issues with the random billing. After 15 minutes and no progress in the line I headed to the airport and just plan on desputing the "other" charge with Visa. If your looking for a full service priced property with a K-Mart service vibe to it, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed; well below average”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: I travel for business a lot and usually always priceline my hotels, and got this one via priceline for $60. It was the Sunday before Memorial Day, I had to travel on Memorial Day out of Baltimore Airport, so I'd figure I drive in a day early and have fun in the city. What a below average experience: 1) Parking was a nightmare. The selfpark garage for the Sheraton only allows SUVs to park on the first level. Meaning if there are no spots you cannot go down lower levels, however you ONLY find that out after you are down there and there are cars behind you looking to park. Thankfully, a Valet guy was walking buy and was able to hop in and back my SUV up through the narrowest of alleys and garner me a spot that Houdini would have had difficulty finding. Unreal. I tipped him a few bucks for his effort. I have never seen a more dysfunctional parking garage, especially for $24 a day 2) The rooms are beat up. Old furniture, shower had plenty of mildew and ancient wallpaper in the bathroom. And it was clear the toilet had not been cleaned if you get my drift. Also the rooms were cramped. Could not see how two people could fit with any comfort. Oh, and there was a hole in my window, not a crack but a physical hole. Yes, a hole the size of a thumb at the base. It looked like it has been there for a while. Have some pride and fix that management 3) Elevators. LOL. Be prepapred for a 5-10 minute wait and I am not kidding. I was on the top floor and it was frustrating waiting 5-10 minutes just to get to your room 4) Margarita at the hotel bar was $9. LOL. Those are NYC prices The crowd in the hotel that night was painfully obnoxious, though I do not blame the hotel for that. There was a Heavy Metal concert in Baltimore which attracted some of the most bizarre people I have ever seen. Not sure why 25 years olds cover themselves with tatoos. You realize one day you will be 40 and will look even more stupid? Lots of heavy metal people loitering around in black tee shirts with dyed black hair The Lacross championships were also in town, so there were a lot of drunk college kids in the hotel, but oh well. That actually brought back memories being drunk in college. I am sure I annoyed plenty of 40 year sold business men in my college days. LOL. I walked down to HarborBay which is a few blocks away. That was a good time, though the seafood I had was terrible down there. You'd think on the water they could learn how to cook shrimp. Just a lousy experience. I just did not like this hotel and if you look at my many reviews, I am certain not particular. But this place was weak.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Cramped Space”
Reviews.Author: lajababu
Reviews.Content: Execellent location, easy access to all major business offices in downtown, negative things are very cramped parking, and noise in room. Has a restaurent/Bar which is good

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but nutty parking situation”
Reviews.Author: taygil
Reviews.Content: Native Marylanders, we spent a mostly pleasant weekend getaway night at this hotel, after enjoying an evening event at the 1st Mariner Arena across the street. The convenience couldn't be beat. The room was small, but clean. and room service was good. BUT, by early evening self-parking was unavailable and we were reliant on the expensive valet parking. After checkout, we had a uncomfortable, hot, 45+ minute wait outside for our car. The great irony is that it took twice as long to get our car than to drive home!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than The Reviews”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreStatus
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for business as I am a Starwood member, but was concerned having looked at the reviews here. The staff were very courteous, appropriate and helpful. The room was very nice - I did get a corner room in the north tower which helped. A little noisey but bearable. Liked the shower only bathroom - clean and modern. And in reference to comment that the location isnt walkable to the harbour district....I am assuming this person doesnt walk further than from their car to their house! 6 blocks is not a trek!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: AquaBlu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a professional conference, and was less than impressed. Although my stay wasn't as bad as some people's experiences (after reading some of the earlier posts about crimes, etc. occurring at the hotel), I would not give this hotel a high rating. The restaurant, Shula's 2, is ridiculously overpriced ($12 for a simple breakfast of two eggs, bacon and hash browns, about the same quality as you'd get at Denny's for half that price; and $35-$40 for a steak of any kind at dinner), and takes full advantage of the fact that you are pretty much a captive audience because the nearest decent restaurant is at least 10 blocks away.
