Likewise, pay-per-view movies are $15.00, more than you would pay to see it at a theater. The room was ok but very noisy due to traffic outside, and the fact that my room was near the ice machine did not help matters (the walls are extremely thin, so sounds from the hallway are loudly audible). The swimming pool was closed (probably an outdoor pool, because it was only open from May-September). The hotel information packet is a tacky stapled-together sheet of papers, and the Shula's restaurant menu is not available in the rooms. Don't use the hotel room phones, even local calls are very expensive (I just used my cell phone for everything). To top it off, security is very lax, and I saw several obviously homeless people walk right in off the streets and into the hotel, and nobody stopped them. A colleague of mine said she was sitting in Shula's having lunch when a homeless man came up to her and asked her for money, and another colleague said a shady looking guy came up to her on the floor where her room was and asked her for a date! Not at all what you'd expect from a "fancy" hotel. It helped that I had several friends attending the conference with me, including a guy friend who often walked me to my room. My friend had a car and said the parking was exorbitantly expensive, and also that he was afraid to take his car out anywhere because he could lose his parking space (parking was not guaranteed to guests). The only good things were proximity to the waterfront tourist attractions (about a 15 minute walk from the Aquarium, USS Constellation, little Italy) and the fact that the rooms were clean and well-appointed, with comfortable beds, good TV service, nice view, etc. (except for the noise). So, overall it was so-so, but I think the hotels closer to the waterfront might be a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: dolcereina
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at this hotel. The people at the front desk were very pleasant and accomodating. We received a phone call as we checked in to see that the room was to our satisfaction. We also received a phone call from room service after every delivery to make sure our order was correct and we had everything we needed. My only complaint was the parking situation... $24 a day to self park and $29 for valet parking. Guests at the hotel did not get free parking. Other than that, we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Machine Gun Shooting Inside the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaleRep
Reviews.Content: A party being held at the hotel resulted in a shooting in the middle of the night. With the sirens that followed I thought the building was on fire. We were terrified. We left as soon as the police released guests to leave. I'll be staying in the Baltimore suburbs in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All-Around!”
Reviews.Author: lbdonaldson
Reviews.Content: When i read the reviews on this site, I was a bit worried about our stay. My daughter and I booked a room here for one night. We were going to the Springsteen concert at the Mariner Arena and even though we only live about an hour away, we decided to spend the next day at the Inner Harbor. We parked right under the hotel (somewhat expensive $22, but it was convenient and safe). Hotel residents DO have in-and-out privileges. The hotel staff were extremely friendly from start to finish. We were greeted warmly, given a goodie bag with a bottled water, apple, and Hershey bar, and went to our room. The room was absolutely immaculate and very fresh looking. The Springsteen concert had booked both this hotel and the other nearby hotels solid. We felt completely safe walking to and from the concert - the area was well-lit and this hotel is just steps across the street from the Arena. Some people in other posts complained about some boarded up stores. Yeah, there are a couple, but if you know Baltimore, you know that this is how it is - the neighborhoods can change street to street. Use common sense and you will be fine. The next morning we had breakfast in the Shula 2 dining room. Really nice buffet with an omelet and waffle station, lovely fruit, meats, potatoes, etc. with orange juice and coffee included. Pricey? Maybe, but it is a restaurant in a hotel, so not unusually so - $16.95 per person for all you could eat. We ate a big breakfast and skipped lunch to have dinner at the harbor later in the day. I can't say enough about the staff. I have traveled extensively and this staff was friendly, helpful, and always available. They walked up to you and asked if there was anything they could do for you. By the time I got to the hotel door, I think I was asked three times by three different staff members if they could do something for me. Excellent! We were on the 18th floor - beautiful view. No noisier than any other hotel in a city. It is a short walk to the Inner Harbor, but we elected to move the car to a closer daily parking garage since we would be leaving after our visit there. We parked at the Pier V parking garage - it is fairly inexpensive and so easy to park in and get back to I83 from there. Plus the room was only $89 for a two double-bed room, so we saved there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but very very noisy outside”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlier1
Reviews.Content: Sheraton has tried to keep the decor of the hotel in good shape (it is wearing slightly). However they need to invest in some triple pane sound deadening windows because the street noise (sirens, buses etc) is horrendous if they are serious about operating in this location as a higher end hotel. Needless to say we did not get a good night's sleep. Also the comments about the area around the hotel are accurate - this borders on what looks like a war zone (most buildings boarded up) - when driving from the hotel we took one wrong turn about 5-10 minutes from the hotel and ended up in what could be termed a ghetto - caution should be exercised.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl3539
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary of staying at this hotel after reading some of the very unfavorable reviews, but since I had such a nice experience there, I felt it fair to even out the odds for people reading the reviews. My husband and I stayed here during a belated honeymoon trip (it was close, convenient, but still 'away'). All the service staff were very friendly and helpful. In fact, when we were checking in, I told the guy at the front desk that we were on our honeymoon, and he put us in a great corner room with lots of extra space and a great view of the city. The room was clean and most importantly, the bathroom was clean. The location is actually not as bad as some people made it out to be. There were several restaurants, shopping places etc. within walking distance. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The only down side that we saw was the parking situation: you have to pay a good bit for hotel parking, but you can get a cheaper rate at the public parking garage directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good but be careful”
Reviews.Author: jursygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal and not too far from the Inner Harbor BUT....it had a few problems. First, it was SO noisy. My husband and I were looking for some peace and quiet that weekend while leaving our 2 year old son that weekend for our anniversary. There were constant sirens going off around the hotel 24-7 all weeekend long. We also had noisy neighbors and the walls are very thin. Next, it is only a couple of blocks from the Inner Harbor but on the line of a shady area. When walking back late at night we had to keep looking over our shoulder. Most of the area seemend nice at one point but a lot of stores have been boarded up and closed. The staff was very nice and the pub was a good place to hang at the end of the night but not sure the good would rise above the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KarenAnne08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in August. We were in Baltimore to see the Red Sox play the Orioles and it was awesome. We had such a great time. The hotel is beautiful. We had a corner room with lots of windows and a great view. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accomodating. It's in a great location, within walking distance to many attractions and popular restaurants and shopping centers. The inner harbor area was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We will definitely be staying at this hotel again. We were completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for Conference”
Reviews.Author: ruggsyrn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a full week during a conference and the room was beautiful and the staff was very courteous...

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: plymouthmaguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights during weekend Red Sox were in town. We only went to one game and visited rest of the city the other days. We did not have any of the problems others noted. Maybe we are clueless, maybe they are picky. Who knows? We had no problem with the parking. Sure it was expensive, but we knew that going in. The staff was excellent and accomodating. Whenever we needed information, a lift, etc. they took care of it. The room was just fine, although I am a bit ticked off the Friday night Red Sox game was not on the room tv, but it was on the bar tv. A shameless attempt to get you to go to the bar and buy drinks. As far as the location - it was just fine in some blocks, not so much in others. If you head west, it gets sketchy. The walk to and from the waterfront was fine. We will probably go back in a couple of years for another Red Sox visit. We will probably make it a shorter trip - you can see Baltimore in a weekend and not have a lot of desire to do it again. But if we do go, we'll probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, okay location, needs a slight makeover”
Reviews.Author: alandubo
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family wedding, so we booked 6 rooms here. Got a great deal of $89 a night over the labor day weekend - considering the inner harbor hotels were well over $100, we took this. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the harbor area. It isn't in the greatest area, and I wouldn't walk around alone at night, but on a nice day it is a fine walk. The hotel rooms are standard Sheraton - very comfortable bed, flat screen, and decent bathroom amenities. The bathroom itself was tiny - big enough for one at a time. One thing that annoyed me was that we were told we were on the club floor. When my key didn't open it, I checked downstairs and she said it was closed. I tried again when I went back up and it worked, and there was breakfast being served. It did close on the weekend (which annoyed me too because the sign on the door has hours 7 days a week), and no one stocked it with water or sodas at all. If you can get a good rate here for much less than a harbor hotel, take it, otherwise for $20 a night more stay at the harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Desolate”
Reviews.Author: gliding_along
Reviews.Content: This hotel boasts about how "close" it is to Camden Yards. The problem is that the Inner Harbor is where all the "action" is and this hotel is in the middle of nowhere. There is nothing to do, no place to eat (see my Shula Steak 2 review: depressing) and completely isolated. There is a 6-7 block walk to the Inner Harbor and the Yards are very close to harbor. The other Shearaton location (or any of the other hotels) at the Inner Harbor are preferable. That walk from the hotel: s-c-a-r-y!!! Granted the room was big and there is a nice gym and pool. We got a deal at $99 per night. Parking was $40 and wi fi was free.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stat here ... You will be sorry (read the whole review)”
Reviews.Author: empresst06
Reviews.Content: Hi fellow travelers, I was in Baltimore for a baseball game yesterday and had such a bad stay that I felt the need to write this the second that I was home from my trip. I am a traveler and have stayed in Sheratons across the country... Never and I mean Never have I experienced what happened to me here. We were scheduled to have a suite do to problems on our last stay with a flood (since it is such an old run down hotel). Of course they did not have our suite reservation and we were told we had a regulargular room, the man at the front then flat out told us that if we "hooked him up" with 10 - 15 bucks he would upgrade us to a corner room. Fine. The next day we had a late checkout so we spent the day in the harbor. When we came back to our rooms around two, we thought we would go up to our rooms and check out without a problem. By the way the room was hot as hell and the beds- hard as rocks. Well we were wrong. When we went to check out , the manager, in front of about 20 people, accused us of smoking pot in the room and told us we had to pay $250 extra for a clean up fee. We had no idea where this was coming from so we asked what he was talking about. We were then told that the head housekeeper, as per their policy, went INTO OUR ROOM while we were out for the day and TOOK PICTURES of our stuff as proof. By the way this was before we checked out and our stuff was out all over the room. Since we were not smoking we tried to dispute it and asked to see the pictures. They then told us that if they had to get the pictures they would take it to the next level and involve the police. We were highly embarrassed as well as in a rush to make our dinner reservations. One of us then payed it and told them we would be contacting headquarters which we did. They were HORRIFIED ! The worst part was that as we were on the way home , we checked our bags. 4 items were missing including CHANNEL SUNGLASSES and expensive cologne. WHAT a GHETTO ! DO NOT STAY HERE ... YOU WILL BE SORRY ! Oh by the way when we arrived, the bars of soap from past customers were still in the showers!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Cltek
Reviews.Content: MY Wife and I went to Baltimore for a weekend getaway. I must say we absolutely loved this place. Will be going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: partyplannerl
Reviews.Content: On the weekend of 8/14 to 8/16 2009 , I recently stayed at the Sheraton Hotel.The hotel is very nice, the only minor problem was that there was no refrigerator available. I did request one before arriving but was told upon arrival that there was a shortage of refrigerators.I must commend the staff early the next morning I did receive my refrigerator. Now my main complaint is the parking I believe that most hotels include parking to guest, some hotels offer free parking or either parking for a small fee. Imagine my surprise upon arrival when directed to the parking garage I was told either valet park for 35.00 + taxes or 27.00 a night to park with no in & out privileges!!!! You are told by the staff that it's a 3 block walk which is not true, I walked it, the 3 blocks would be the street that the harbor is on but to get to the main mall & attractions is a little farther than that! Once you are suckered into the parking I say suckered because there is no on the street parking so you have to park at the hotel garage or the one across the street. The one across the street is $18.00 a night also with no in & out privileges& no security underground!. If you don't move your car then you have to pay for transportation which is more money!! They have these guys outside hawking cab or car rides to the harbor,(that backs up my point that the harbor is not 3 blocks away!) We took one of these cabs to a restaurant in the harbor it was $8.00!!! That's $35.00 already spent on the first night $27.00 to park and 8 for a cab ride. We walked back to the hotel and it was a nice walk back but again it wasn't 3 blocks! In this economy people do budget in for parking but I don't think no one expects to be bullied into paying 27.00 0r $18.00 a night. So to all potential guest please beware because it is truly highway robbery!! P.S. Don'y try to complain at the front desk, they will only tell you they have nothing to do with the parking. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for money.”
Reviews.Author: cmjm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed very much. Staff very friendly, room very clean. Very nice pool area and fitness center. Ate 2 mornings in Shulas 2 downstairs of hotel and food excellent. Quick walk to inner harbor. Only downside was expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Manager on Duty ever”
Reviews.Author: spartan26
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the lobby was nice the front desk staff was friendly, but the most important person running the show was terrible. The Manager on Duty Richard was so rude. We asked for simple directions and he had to grab a bell man who was busy helping another guest. This was the worst Manager I have ever met! He could not do anything right, he looked so lost among the mist of guest asking for help. I will never ever stay at this hotel again just because of this man. One word for this manager Rude!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing to say the least”
Reviews.Author: Brkln71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife when we travelled to Baltimore. Check in took forever. The elevators took forever. The room was OK but the bathroom was not. The toilet was old and had mildew all over the bowl. When we walked home after having some drinks on the harbor there were prostitutes on the same block as the hotel. I was happy we were staying there only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Sox fans!!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoMiss
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at the Sheraton Baltimore after reading some of the reviews...but our stay was lovely! We had tickets to the Red Sox game and were late checking in. The hotel staff was quick to get our room and was able to change our double bed room to a king size room with no problem even though we booked on a discount website. The room was clean and had a gorgeous view of the Baltimore skyline. There was complimentary water and coffe for the am. The bathroom was a bit small, but that can be expected in the city. There were the standard toiletries, but they added a lovely bonus of shower gel with a little poof thing for the shower!! I never heard any of the other guests. As an added bonus, they had a large Red Sox "B" in the lobby from some sort of light. We parked in the garage across the street for $18 a night thanks to reading some of the other reviews first and saved ourselves quite a bit of money. Quick walk to Camden Yards. Didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as it was quite expensive, per usual at hotels of this sort. Only bummer was there wasn't free internet in the room. We were quite pleased overall with the stay!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SBAR13
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever stayed in, and interestingly enough, the most expensive. The lobby was nice and welcoming, and when we first arrived, I was impressed. I was expecting things to be nice. Unfortunately, things went wrong from the start when the mini-fridge I asked for (several months ago) was denied. While I understand that guests with medical reasons should be given first dibs, I booked this room MONTHS ago, and they have had time to prepare. All of the floors, except the lobby, had dreary and unwelcoming colors. They looked right out of a horror movie. It was creepy and unpleasant. The room we were given was tiny and crowded, one of the lights didn't work, and there was no fitted sheet on the bed. You heard it - no fitted sheet. I woke up in the morning laying on a bare mattress. The bathroom was also cramped, and we had no bath, just a shower. The shower's tiled floor was excruciatingly uncomfortable on my tired feet and made showering one of the most unpleasent aspects of the weekend. Now, as for the AC - it was on a motion sensor. When we left the room and returned, we were greeted with a hot muggy room, even though we left the AC on to cool things down. As well, when we were sleeping, the AC would turn off and the room quickly heated up leading to an uncomfortable evening. Furthermore, the hotel was unable to provide us with parking, so we were forced to park on the other side of town for $75 extra, and carry our luggage through Baltimore City streets from the most inconvenient location possible. Horrible hotel. Not recommended. On the plus side, the staff was friendly. They didn't help us at all, but if they had been rude, the trip would have been ruined completely.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay - Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DevilsGrl1121
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for one night when we were in town for the Notre Dame/Navy Game and it was a very nice stay. I don't remember our view, I don't believe we had one, but for one night in the middle of a city, it's not a big deal. To self-park was odd having to go across the street, underground then back up and across again but the bed was unbelievably comfy, clean bathrooms and for a football weekend, the noise level was contained within the rooms. The bartenders were very nice and the drink prices were as expected for a city. Overall, a nice stay if passing through town.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irishfan545
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for a week. It was on the John Hopkins Hospital recommended list as I had a family member having surgery at the hospital. The hotel has a great concierge and a nice restaurant called Shula's Steak House but otherwise was a major disappoinment. The air conditioning in my room did not work properly and I needed to be moved to another floor. Both rooms that I stayed in had carpet stains. Often when I went to use my key my key would not work. I had to call Security twice because of noise problems late at night. The parking rates are very deceptive and not made clear to people checking in. And on the last day of my visit I had no hot water. All in all, avoid it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good customer service”
Reviews.Author: adamste123
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but well worth the $68 dollars per night that I paid. I would have been really upset if I would have paid the $189 listed on the hotel website. The room was very small but very clean. The bed was not very comfortable to me but my husband didn't mind it. The temperature in the room was fluctuate from really hot to really cold also. (We set the thermostat on 70.) We used the pool which was clean but the pool furniture was really old and stained. The metal stairs in the pool were broken. It was really funny when we got off the elevator to the pool and gym floor. The carpet on the whole floor is lumpy and bubbly. It is like it isn't even attached to the floor or something. I meant to take a picture of it for trip advisor but I forgot. It was just really funny to us. The hotel is about 6 blocks from the inner harbor. There were a couple of bums asking for money on the way but we just ignored them and they didn't bother us. Oh, when we arrived at the hotel, the employees were protesting out front. We went in through the garage and self parked to avoid. BTW self parking was $54.00 for 2 nights. The hotel was quiet and the customer service was really good. Hotel employees were super friendly. Breakfast at Shulas 2 was good. We had the buffet. Typical hotel prices, 16.95 for buffet, included beverage of coffee or orange juice. Room service was fine. We ordered a pizza and it was surprisingly really good. The gratutity was automatically added at 18 % which I find very convienent. Overall, if you aren't picky, and if you get a good deal, stay there. I wouldn't pay more than 99.00 per night because you have to pay an arm and a leg for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice on the inside!”
Reviews.Author: msmolins
Reviews.Content: The outside of this hotel makes you think it's just another chain, but I was very happy with the quality of the rooms. The lobby is very pretty and the staff was pleasant for check in. The rooms were much nicer than I expected, considering the low price I paid. It is within walking distance of Inner Harbor and we even walked to Little Italy, which took about 20 minutes. I will definitely stay here again next time I am in Baltimore. Also, the bathrooms were clearly just redone and they were great. Clean and neat and stylish, and they had great shampoo and conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Small yet pleasant, modern rooms, but bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful, room in southwest tower with a nice decor and interesting artwork. Clean, comfortable bed. Broad selection of pillows. Starbucks coffee in room. Pleasant, efficient staff. Logical division of hotel into quadrants to eliminate the overwhelming feeling of large, impersonal hotels. Crisp HD plasma, though of the limited 20 channels, at least 10 - including ABC, CNN, CBC and NBC - never worked throughout the 3-day stay (black screen). Good soundproofing between rooms- never heard anything from other rooms. Nice location for inner harbor and Camden Yards, and a good deal for under $100. Cons: $27/night parking ($45 for valet) as of June 2009. Small bathroom- door barely clears the toilet; minimal counter space. Toilet would not flush; took three service calls with lengthy waits to have an 'engineer' come up. Fire trucks pass on W Baltimore St. (on the south end of hotel) all hours of the night, though not an issue for floors 10+. Ice machines on every fourth floor; ones on 3rd, 7th, and 11th did not work- had to hit the 16th floor to finally get one that dispensed anything. Avoid the dilapidated staircases at all costs. Tip: I used the underground parking garage in the middle of the street directly in front of the hotel (W Fayette St.). Rates are $18/night, and only $7.75 for those arriving after 4pm and out by 9am. About as reasonable as you will find in this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service, very comfortable room, nice linens,terric value”
Reviews.Author: grandmerelorian
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding. We took the Light Rail train from BWI to the Convention Center Stop and walked over to the hotel from there, about 3 blocks. Our room was on the 24th floor of the South Tower, looking toward Camden Yards ball field.The room was large, with 2 very comfortable double beds, lots of pillows of different sizes. The bathroom was large and clean, plenty of towels and shelves.The air conditioning system was not adjusted correctly, but Guest Services sent an engineer to fix it - he arrived within 2 minutes! the system itself was whisper-quiet, in fact the quietest I've ever experienced. Because we were so high above the street, there was very little outside noise. There were at least two conventions in the hotel, but we were untroubled by conversation, doors slamming, etc. We found all the desk personnel and Guest Services people to be friendly, well-trained and accomodating. Because I's spoken to asomeone at the Concierge desk before we went, I expected there would be someone there when we arrived, but we never saw that desk manned the whole time we were there. My adult daughter and I stayed two nights, breakfasted in the hotel's pleasant Shula's restaurant both times. Our Server there was the delightful Miss Evette, who waited on us in the most cheerful and friendly way possible. We really enjoyed our stay in this clean and cheerful, well-staffed hotel. I would certainly recommend it to anyone, but it is in the business center area of the city, not near the Inner Harbor. When we had checked in and put our bags in the room, we went looking for lunch, but found very little choice nearby at 4p.m. on a Friday, ended up at a very shabby fast-food place several blocks away. I would advise that one try to be placed as high up and away from street noise as possible when making the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER BOOK THIS HOTEL........”
Reviews.Author: TSPDC
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Baltimore City Center Hotel had poor customer service from the start. Their staff has not been well trained. The reservation was booked incorrectly and key details were left out to make the stay a pleasant one. One staff member tried to do damage control but the damage had already been done. The check in was a nightmare. The manager actually was the worst of all and did not take the lead in setting the bar for his staff. If you want to be treated well do not stay at this Sheraton. The excuse I was given is that they are a franchise. Go figure...

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place to visit inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: kushmoney
Reviews.Content: Was not the closest to the inner harbor but it is only a few block walk to either the harbor, or camden yards/ravens stadium. We found this place much more affordable than any of the places a few blocks closer and the hotel is very clean, modern, and the rooms were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Opethgirl
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone, This is my second review of this hotel. It is a nice hotel, and the rooms are very clean. I did notice this time around that we can hear more hallway noise, although, I think this particular woman was very loud. My only complaint is that this hotel doesn't offer a continental breakfast, however, the buffet for $16.95 is worth it. Don't bother ordering off the breakfast menu, it's cheaper for the buffet and the food is the same. Finally, when we got there the desk clerk couldn't find our reservations, he was able to get us into a room however. Once I got home, I looked through my email reservation confirmation and the date was way off. She had booked it for March and not May. So, be sure to check your reservation email carefully when you receive it from them. Thanx for reading, I hope this was helpful. Jen \m/

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: renee4rj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night this past weekend. We were not aware of the 40 per day valet parking. We also had a 50 dollar deposit because we used a visa debit card. The room was comfortable but not worth 190 per night. You are also charged for wireless internet acccess.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Ilenya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The room was OK, although the bedspread was stained. But worse, when I checked out I left a necklace in the room. Two hours later I realized and checked and it was gone. I asked for help tracking it down. The staff made some minor attempts to find it, but basically refused to follow up, and the manager didn't answer my calls. As far as I'm concerned, the hotel was party to my necklace being stolen. This is outrageous for a "decent" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: mellisa05
Reviews.Content: Well to start off with we had to pay for our parking. Which was almost 80 extra dollars. Then when we checked in we were told they needed a deposit then we were supposed to have a king bed. They didn't have any available after we booked it. So we got two doubles which was awful because it was Valentines Day. I hated every moment of it. We also had a Visa gift card so we didn't have to carry cash or our real cards and they wouldn't except it. And I didn't sleep very well because all u heard all night was siruns it sucked don't ever stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value despite miscues”
Reviews.Author: TheRat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in two rooms with family for 2 nights. Though there were number of miscues by the hotel, they were more than made up for by the value and location. Price per night (Sat/Sun) seems to be in the $99 range in the winter - great for a hotel about 5 blocks from the Inner Harbor. We paid cash and points as SPG members. Hotel had clearly been upgraded a couple of years ago - new furnishings in rooms, and a paint job in the hall that was clearly covering older paint. Miscue #1 - OK, we arrived on Valentines day to find no hotel parking - however, we were pointed to a lot across the street (without in and out privileges) that ended up costing us $15.50 per day rather than the $35 valet charge per day. $40 savings to me for this miscue. Miscue #2 - non-working coffee machine in one room - not a big deal as we had two rooms. In addition, miscue 2A - housekeeping took the faulty machine but forgot to replace it, and did not restock sugar and creamer in that room. Result - on check-out, my family got free drinks from the restaurant as my wife couldn't make coffee in the room, one of my kids got a gift bag from the hotel, and they gave us 500 points to our SPG account. We had only asked for extra sugar on the way out for the one cup of coffee that we made in the other room. All of the rest was immediately volunteered by the front desk. Miscue #3 - on return to the hotel after a day of touring, there were no lights on our floor. as it turns out, the engineering department shut electricity to our floor as they were mistakenly told that it was empty after all of the Valentines Day departures. this was resolved in the time that it took me to park our car. Even with these miscues, I'd stay here again. the hotel is fine, the staff helpful and friendly, the location is great, and the price is amazing compared to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and very reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: sdesai66
Reviews.Content: Well I grew up around here so I pretty much know most of the hotels downtown. My friend and I stayed here so we could go out for her birthday and crash at the hotel. This hotel was the cheapest out of most of the ones we found and in a good place. It's right up the street from the harbor and you can catch a cab very easily around there. The hotel also has a free shuttle that will take you anywhere around Baltimore. It was really nice on the inside. Kind of small but very nice. It was clean, the beds were very comfortable. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great. Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: dbeals
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation via the SPG website and then called a few days before to ask if I could have an upgrade. We are gold members and were going to be there on business for 4 days so we wanted to see if we could spread out. They said yes, and in fact did not even charge me more. Now I know why. The place was recently renovated but very poorly and cheaply. We got to the hotel, and our “suite” was no longer available. In fact, the front desk had no record of our upgrade. Took 15 minutes of looking to figure out that we had been upgraded. Turns out the room was occupied by guest who stayed an extra night. This happens, so I asked for another suite. The woman at the front desk (after waiting for 15 minutes more) sent us to a room that was just a mess - huge whirlpool tub from the 70s, tall ceilings but by no means a suite. After 30 minutes more of waiting in the room we finally got another room which (while a suite) was a mess. The ‘suite’ part of the room was large but with not much in it – a bad faux leather sofa and some chairs with a large dining table. The room was also very dark – only lighting was over the table. I asked for some lamps. After 60 minutes, and another call (turned out they sent the lamps to another room) the lamps showed up. That was just the beginning of a horrible stay. Not again. The staff was polite and nice but it’s just a poorly run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2007
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and the decor. Very clean, modern, great television, comfortable bed, and pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed_7
Reviews.Content: If you want to walk to some downtown Baltimore sites and the Inner Harbor area, this is a great choice. My wife and I found a great last-minute deal (through the hotel website) on a Saturday night at the Sheraton City Center Hotel in Baltimore, MD. This hotel has a wonderful location: it is an easy and safe three or four blocks walk to the Basilica of the Assumption, Walters Art Museum, and original Washington monument. It is also only a ten minute walk to the Inner Harbor area, which is full of shops, restaurants, and the National Aquarium. We even walked to the closest movie theater, which was a pleasant one mile walk through the Inner Harbor area. We parked at the underground parking garage across the street, which was $18 per 24 hours (trust me, a good rate in this town). The hotel is quite large: it has two tall towers. We were in the South Tower on the 22nd (of 27) floors. Our room was one of the smaller ones, but very clean, had a king size bed, LCD TV, a desk, a large cloest, and a nicely renovated bathroom with a shower only (no tub). It had a nice view of the surrounding Baltimore skyscrapers. The best part of the stay was the concierge, Yul. He was incredibly helpful. He directed us to all the sites, ones we knew we wanted to see and others that we didn't even know about. He had great suggestions for restaurants. He even looked up the closest movie theater and showing times for us. He delivered A+ service. The hotel has two restaurants: Shulas (fancy), and Shula's 2 (casual). We had a 10:30am brunch on Sunday at Shula's 2. The only thing immediately available was the breakfast buffet (it would 25 minutes if we wanted to order off the menu, we were told). There was a good selection: an omlete bar chef, bacon, good real eggs, tasty sausages, a nice fruit selection, cereal boxes, oatmeal, and french toast (not so good!). Although the food was really of fairly good quality, it was overpriced at $17 per person. It wasn't that good. All in all, a nice hotel with good clean rooms and a great staff. I highly recommend it if you like to walk. It's probably a bit cheaper than staying in the Inner Harbor area itself, and the walk down there is a quick and pleasant one. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - outrageous price”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights during a business trip. The hotel itself was fine although the bathroom was tiny (no bathtub, just shower). The nightly rate, however, was outrageous - $250+tax. Self parking was steep too - $20. If you're an SPG gold or premium member, you can get access to the club lounge which was great. They have soft drinks all day, a nice breakfast, appetizers in the evening, and a dessert buffet at night - except for alcohol, everything is free. Also, if you're getting dinner, try Shulla's 2 (sports bar) instead of Shulla's - it's the same menu (except lobster) but a lot cheaper. Their crab cake is excellent - $24 on appetizer menu at Shulla's and and $14 as sandwich with side dish at Shulla's 2.

Reviews.Title: “terrific personel”
Reviews.Author: bobhunter007
Reviews.Content: people were great. i left a jacket in the room and when i called to check lost and found - they had it and offered to send it to my home DHL and it arrived the next day. Gineene(probably mispelled) was the person in charge of lost and found - terrific service. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Fun!”
Reviews.Author: madisonreed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in Sept. 2008 for a weekend of family fun. I own a travel agency, so went into this fully expecting a 3-4 star hotel (nothing fancy but pleasant). The pricing was 50% less than the other hotels in the area and we knew that we would not be there much anyway. I had stayed here in the past when it was owned by another company, so it was nice to return. Check-in- Check-in was pleasant and fast! Thumbs up for this! We were given 2204 in the North Wing which was a Club room (we are also Starwood Guests). Room- The room was clean, comfortable and had Starbucks Coffee which my hubby appreciated tremendously. Bottled water was complimentary since we were in the Club lounge room. We went to the Club lounge a few times for sodas and to spread out on the sofas and enjoyed having this extra space. During the week, the lounge offers continential breakfast and appetizers at night. Staff-The staff here was super! This was the absolute best part of this hotel. We actually met the Food and Beverage Manager (Ashish) at lunch at Shula 2's and he even gave our children chocolate:) The managers are visible and do seem to truly care about your happiness. Ashish was a warm and friendly man and is an asset to this hotel. We ate here twice and both servers, Angela and Laverne were just fantastic. They were so kind to our children, were excellent servers and we really looked forward to our meals with them. The Sunday brunch was plentiful and tasty to all. Location-The location was fine, in regards to the Inner Harbor. It was probably about 6 blocks away and was certainly easy to walk. If you need a cab, they were everywhere. We did not find the area to be unsafe like others have mentioned. Fitness Room-I did not use this, but it looked in very good condition. Remember, you get what you pay for and if you want a pleasant, clean place to stay (at a great price!!!!!) you would really enjoy this hotel. The people at this hotel are truly their finest asset! Thank you to the Sheraton City Center-we will be back soon!!!!! Please ask if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Responsive Management”
Reviews.Author: RedsFans
Reviews.Content: I read through all the reviews before selecting this hotel based on price and less critical than others of same value in the area. Needed a place downtown so we could walk to Camden Yards. We arrived on time and received the news that even though we were booked and paid for in advance - our king size room was not available... two full would have to do. I explained that they had a reputation on Expedia for saying that - and unfortunately that was not acceptable - we want the room we have already paid for. They were able to open a room up for us... During the night the lobby areas outside our room was extremely noisy and disturbing in the extreme. From another group staying in the hotel and not being very courteous to others. Management followed up with us while we were at Shula's 2 and they were very very kind to us and apologized. I think that was wonderful. We would stay here again when we are in town - I felt like we mattered to the management - and that was the selling point. The service and food at Shula's was great - we spent the day watching various football games there... warm inviting and great food and people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice place”
Reviews.Author: kwhitey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a bit of a dicey neighborhood, but I experienced no problems. I was there for a conference for 2 nights, 3 days. My room was in the North Tower and was fine. The staff were very accommodating and helpful. The food at the conference was well above average for hotel/conference food.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Baltimore!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Manoafamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this awesome hotel for 2 months while our daughter went through treatment at Johns Hopkins and our experience was simply amazing! From the discounted rate that they gave for Johns Hopkins patients to the free shuttle service to and from the hospital to the excellent service from the valet, bellmen, front desk, security, maintenance team, Shula's restaurant, staff & management ~ it was an experience we will never forget. Coming all the way from Hawaii to the East Coast to a city earmarked as the 3rd most dangerous city in America, we had our questions and doubts, especially since I (mom) had to stay with my daughter the majority of our stay by ourselves because dad had to fly back to Hawaii to work. I was anxious & worried but the staff & management at the Sheraton Baltimore were so wonderful in taking care of us and helping us with whatever we needed to make our stay comfortable, safe & fun. My daughter's "entertainment" was going down to the lobby after a hard day of treatment and saying "HI" to the employees who treated her like a princess. They were amazing ~ when the time came to come home, we were happy but sad. We were leaving a family that we have come to love and appreciate so much and a room that we were able to call "home." It was an incredible experience ~ THANK YOU to all of you at the Sheraton Baltimore who made us feel so cared for and loved. We will never forget our new Baltimore family. When our daughter grows up she is insisting on going back and working at the hotel that she has grown to love. Excellent hotel in everyway ~ super clean, incredible service, friendly family atmosphere, awesome employees, centrally located, great restaurant ~ I TOTALLY recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an awesome hotel to stay at while visiting Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: carverfam
Reviews.Content: We were flying out of Baltimore and wanted to stay near the Inner Harbour for the evening. We booked this property on Hotwire for $130 and were more than pleased. The Sheraton is beautiful. They are obviously upgrading the property and have chosen gorgeous furniture and fixtures. We stayed in the north tower (no great view) but had an oversized room with really comfortable beds. The bathrooms look like a Pottery Barn ad. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It's a seven block walk to Inner Harbour -- ask the staff the best route as some of the streets are lined with "Adult Entertainment" clubs that come alive after dark. Parking is rather expensive, but we would stay at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Stinks”
Reviews.Author: ldob
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed staying at the sheraton even when it was the Wyndham. This past weekend we were in town for the Yankees game. I gave my valet ticket to the person running the desk and he very rudely told me I had to wait 40 minutes for my vehicle. After enquring about the guy I was shocked to learn that he was the parking manager. I do not think I will ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - not great - but nice”
Reviews.Author: meg7456
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid August 2008 in the North tower - fifth floor. Had none of the problems previously mentioned - it was a good stay. The staff was, as previously mentioned, excellent. Room was clean and housekeeping arrived at around 2 pm every day. The lobby area is nice and the on-site restaurants are quite good. The one problem is the street people that frequent the area and occasionally manage to infiltrate the hotel lobby itself. They are quite aggressive about begging for money. They approach with an extended hand, which if one accepts, apparently gives the beggar license to expound some ridiculous story that involves either the bus station or a local hospital and the need for $14. After one such encounter I blew the subsequent players off - and in one such instance he became violent and abusive. I noticed that the bell staff is fairly alert and that they move them along with a simple harsh glance. Other than that (which is not the fault of the hotel) I enjoyed my four night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel _ Terrible Area”
Reviews.Author: PaulTravels
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at this hotel, twelve of us stayed here and watched the Red Sox play the O's. All the reivews are on target here, elevators etc.. Our rooms were actually very nice. I would not recommend this hotel nor would I stay here again simply because of the surrounding area. With a mixed crowd, young to old, we felt very unsafe walking to and from this hotel--and we are from the greater NYC area. For a conference, or an "all guy" trip to Baltimore--great place, not the place to be traveling with a family. Many many many better located hotels nearer to the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give a negative overall rating I would!”
Reviews.Author: HBTHampshire
Reviews.Content: I have never had a hotel experience like it! The restaurant had staff who were indifferent to customers, took an age delivering the order and when it came it was wrong! When we left in the morning the valet driver behind us but on the garage side to the barrier thought that the right way to treat guests was to repeatedly us the horn to move us along more quickly. However the real problem was neither of these: We were staying in a room above the 20th floor and at about 9pm a fire alarm went off. We walked down over 20 floors with another couple and their kids (the lady was pregnent) to be greeted by a scene of .... utter indiffernece. The check in desk were still checking in people, the bell boy was still trying to deliver luggage to rooms (but to be fair took the fire alarm seriously once we informed him). To cap it all the kitchen were still trying to deliver room service in an elevator that wasn't working due to the fire alarm. The fire department were on site and yet not a soul was evacuated from the building and the check in desk were still checking people into a hotel in which there was a fire alram! The management were offhand in the extreme and downright rude on occasion as we were trying to understand what had happened after an hour or so of waiting. No information was given despite asking for some. We ended up moving to a 2nd floor room for safety. If this hotel has proper fire procedures then they certainly weren't followed. The conclusion: if you're out of reach of the fire ladders this place is a death trap.

Reviews.Title: “Some things great, other things not - is it a work in progress?”
Reviews.Author: ChiefGreg
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Baltimore to attend the 25th annual Firehouse Expo, which I have done for all 25 years. I have stayed at various hotels through those years. This year, through the convention's housing bureau, I selected the Sheration Baltimore City Center Hotel, as it was the hotel closest to the convention center at the time I booked. I know from my travels to Baltimore that this used to be an Omni hotel, and I think until recently it was a Westin Hotel. So I'm assuming that this has been a Sheraton for only a year or two. After my visit, I'm almost certain of it, as the place appears to be a work in progress. I'll start by saying that the hotel's best asset is it's staff. Every staff person that I had the opportunity to deal with was friendly, effiicient and seemed more than willing to do whatever they could to help you enjoy your stay. Two other plusses that I can mention from my trip is that the place seemed very clean, and that my room had a digital thermostat on the wall to control the temperature in my room. There was also a complimentary USA Today at my door each morning, and a printed folio of my stay's charges was slipped under my door on the moring of my check out. However, I did have a lot of small issues with the hotel and my room. I was on the seventh floor of the infamous south tower, in a handicap accesssible room on a non-smoking floor. I chose a non-smoking room, but the handicap room was a surprise. The room had a large bathroom, obviously since it was designed for wheelchair access. It included a large shower (no tub) a toilet and a basin. There was only one small towel bar, so towels, etc. were hung from the handicap bars that were placed on the walls of the bathroom. There was no shelf whatsoever for toiletries, so a box of tissues, and soap and shampoos, etc. filled the small space on the top of the toilet tank. There was no place for me to place my personal toiletries or even a glass for water. A shelf and some more towel bars were needed in the bathroom. The room came with two king side beds, so obviously was set up so that four people could share the room. However, there was a single three-drawer dresser under the TV set, and absolutely no place to sit your luggage other than on the floor or on a bed. Not even a folding luggage stand was available in the room. Trying to find out what services were available in the hotel could only be found in a stapled together set of 8.5" x 11" pages that were out of alphabetical order, and not the normal booklet found in most hotels. The room service menu was a similar stapled together in-house production that was in even worse shape. The only other furnishings in the room was a table/desk with a conference room stacking chair to sit on at the desk. No other chair was available in the room. There were two outlets on the tabletob, obviously so it could be used as a desk, but no desk lamp and no internet access was available in the room. I had noticed in the hotel lobby a paper sign advising that wireless access was available there, but when I got down there with my laptop I found that said access was $9.95 per day, and a credit card was needed to use it. Not very business user friendly of the hotel. I did find a network cable under the table, but it was not hooked to anything and no network outlet was found in the room. I finally settled for dialup access, but had to call the front desk the second night when I somehow got blocked from being able to make a local call. The phone on the desk was missing the cover that told you what all the buttons were for, so I had to rely on the desk by the bed to make any calls for hotel services. There was not a local phone book of any kind to be found in the room either. Calling for an elevator in the south tower usually resulted in a three minute wait (I finally timed the wait) to get a car to your floor. I only ever saw two of the three elevators in use, so I am assuming that the third one was out of service. Also out of service was the ice machine on my floor, requiring a visit to another machine either two floors up or down, usually a five minute trip ro more with the slow elevators. This ice machine was out of service for my entire stay. I can confirm that there is street noise in the room, however the only noise that awoke me when sleeping was the sirens from the fire apparatus using Baltimore Street. There was also quite a bit of noise from the doors to the other rooms on the floor, as the hinges screech and the doos slam shut. I can only hope that Sheraton is still working on this property, as it is in need of many finishing touches. There wasn't even any art on the walls of the room.

Reviews.Title: “An perfectly acceptable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: swandive81
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at this hotel at the very last minute, after reading terrible reviews about the hotel we were supposed to stay. This hotel was incredibly average... nothing that made the stay good or bad. The rooms seem a bit dated, which is odd considering they were just redone, and it seems absurd this day and age not to offer free internet connection (the sheraton charged $10 a day). The room was okay... clean, average side, a bit spare. Nothing noteworthy, but nothing to run from, either. The price was incredibly competitive, especially since we booked with less than 24 hours notice... the price we got online was easily $100 less than surrounding properties. The neighborhood was a bit sketchy, but I think that's just the nature of the city. Valet parking was costly, but the valet was forthcoming with cheaper off-site parking options when asked (we did valet anyway). The best part of the hotel is its proximity to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards... we easily walked to both

Reviews.Title: “Great Pet Friendly Hotel close to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: 2fromtkpk
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing experience at this hotel. Every single experience with a staff member was pleasant. They allow dogs under 40lbs with no extra charge, only a deposit. Short walk to the Inner Harbor. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask...and you shall receive”
Reviews.Author: emalemi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the front desk an hour before check-in time, and were greeted warmly by the staff. "Welcome to the Sheraton" Lucky for us, a room was ready. Thanks to previous reviews, we had made a request for the South Tower-higher floor upon booking, and that's exactly what we received. From the lobby to the elevator, the surroundings are very pleasant. The nautical black and white photography touches were very nice, and this trend continued in our room. Our king room was on the small side, however perfect for two (2) adults. A leather headboard in deep tones, dark wood side tables, desk, and dresser. The wall mounted flat screen was a nice modern touch, and the bedding was a mix of whites and navy to go along with the nautical flair. A striped wallpaper of white and blue, was a nice backdrop to the white sink, and large white tiled shower in the bathroom. Modern fixtures and shelving in crome was a nice touch. Thick white bath towels, hand towels, and wash cloths were plentiful. Not your usual one set per person. After a day of short walks to the Inner Harbor, water taxi rides to Fells Point for cold beer and dinner, and an evening at Camden Yards, the hotel's location allowed for parking the car upon arrival, and not needing it again throughout our stay. A comfortable bed was a lovely way to end a great day. Would we stay at this property again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a conference, but ...”
Reviews.Author: skigarmisch
Reviews.Content: I found myself at the Sheraton for business conference in March of this year. I was hoping for cooler weather, but alas, I must have brought my Houston heat because it was pretty warm outside! The hotel was chosen by my employer as all our meetings were to take place there. The rooms were adequate, but the furnishings were old and the bedding as well. A colleague had stains in her bed, but mine was clean, despite the "oldness." It reminded me of the 70's, which is cool and all, but not in a business setting and not when the rest of the hotel is up-to-date with amenities and furnishings. All in all, the conference went very well. I should notate that I was walking around in a fitted boot due to a recently broken foot and severely sprained ankle and it was tough walking all over the hotel to attend various meetings and eat lunch. Beautiful setting outside the windows, but not so much in our individual rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I rated this property Above Average because of the staff--they were exceptional. Otherwise, this property would rate an average. I was here Tuesday through Friday on the seventh floor of South Tower. The room had two double beds and was a corner room. My daughter had business to conduct and I agreed to go along and be nanny to her fourteen-month-old son. The staff was very friendly and helpful to me. They often spoke to my grandson and were especially attentive to our needs. One afternoon he was crawling around a seating area in the lobby while I talked to my daughter on the phone and in the blink of an eye he managed to squeeze himself between the sofa and the wall becoming stuck. A bellman helped me move the sofa to retrieve him and brought a stuffed animal from the gift shop to help me calm him. In the restaurant, Shulas 2, the staff offered to entertain him so i could take advantage of the breakfast buffet. When my keycard would not work one day and I explained that i was calling from the seventh floor house phone they told me they would send someone right up to assist me so i would not have to return to the lobby with the baby. They delivered the crib to our room soon after we checked in. I was very impressed with the staff and their kindness and attention. They always helped us get transportation and opened the doors and offered help with packages, stroller, etc. The room itself being a corner room was larger than I expected. The comforters were a navy stripe and the heavy curtains were a navy and red plaid. The desk chair was green and obviously a mis-match for the decor. There was a large flat screen television atop a set of drawers with attached desk. There was an additional small writing table with a drawer that opened to provide a writing surface. There was a red easy chair and ottoman. There were large windows on the outer walls of the room and I liked the view and the light. We looked at the First Mariner Arena on one side and another hotel (Residence or Rennaissance I forget) on the other. The problem was the street noise as many others have stated. We heard sirens and truck gears and other noises into the night. While I am a heavy sleeper and slept though it all my daughter and grandson had fitful nights. The internet was unavailable in our room for our entire stay. My daughter was one of thirty people in her group staying in the hotel and she said that some of her group had requested a new room due to the problem with internet and had been able to find a room with internet connectivity. My daughter went to the lobby where internet connectivity was very expensive--by minutes rather than by day. This was most exasperating for her and for me as we were both expecting to be able to work from the room. I was able to use my Blackberry for email, but could not access other information I needed. Because we had the crib and all the baby items we decided not to change rooms, but if you plan to visit there within the next few weeks and internet connectivity is important to you, check the connectivity before unpacking--you may want to change rooms. The bathroom is very small and we had a tub and a shower, but there was almost no counterspace in the room. The top of the toilet is curved and sloped and the sink was one on legs with a small rim around the bowl. The shelves above the toilet had tissue and folded towels so we had trouble with our toiletries in the cramped space. I had several meals in the restaurant, Shula's 2. All were good, and overpriced as most meals are in this setting. Twice I did have to look for the waitress to get my check, but both times the place was packed and the waitresses appeared to be working hard as opposed to just being unattentive. The hotel is within walking distance of the Inner Harbor. While the people in the hotel were very friendly I was disappointed in much of what i encountered on the streets outside the hotel. Baltimore calls itself charm city, but I did not see a lot of good manners while I was there. Few people opened the door for me and anyone who has ever tried to push a stroller knows that maneuvering doors is not always easy. I also found that the sidewalks were not all that friendly to someone handicapped by a stroller. Curbs are steep and often the sloped access for handicapped is not available or convenient--I had to travel out of my way several times in order to travel on the sidewalks and access properties. I ate in two places at the Inner Harbor and the service at the tapas place there was awful. Service and food at the M and S Grill was very good. I was really surprised at the number of times people just slammed the door in front of the stroller or practically pushed me through a door when I was trying to unstick the wheels from a threshold. The trolley rails in the streets also grab stroller wheels.....I saw what appeared to be a drug transaction on the corner of the street a block from the hotel and the smell of urine outside the Lexington Market (a few blocks West) is almost unbearable. While I never felt unsafe in the daytime I did not feel comfortable walking alone in some areas that were not too far from the hotel. Getting a taxi from the hotel was never a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Missing basic business amenities”
Reviews.Author: SantaFean-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the City Center Sheraton during a conference: two nights in a suite and two nights in a king room. (The rooms were comped because I was with the convention-staging company.) There were only three differences between the two rooms: (1) the suite included a room with a sofa, second TV, and a round "meeting" table (2) the king room had a shower only, and (3) the suite came with Starbucks coffee for the coffee maker instead of Maxwell House. The beds were comfortable, but the windows offered next to no sound insulation. I heard sirens several times a night and, one night, jackhammering in the street below till after 10. Nothing to be done about that; just be aware. More disappointing was the lack of wifi in the rooms and the absence of an in-room safe. Accessing the Internet (which I had to do for work several hours each afternoon) required paying $10 for an Internet connection that logged me out at 3 (check-in time) each day. I even had to provide my own Ethernet cable. Other, cheaper chains (like Holiday Inn Express) have provided better accommodations for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “the BEST conference location”
Reviews.Author: coasttraveler
Reviews.Content: I was an exhibitor at the recent TASI conference. This was a busy event, with hours from 7AM to well into the evening. As an exhibitor I appreciated the attention I received from the hotel staff - including the Bell Desk. They quickly transferred my exhibit materials from the car; told me where to park easily; met me at the table and unloaded for me. They were there at the end of the event - offering help to load up, etc. I've been at host hotels where the staff wouldn't help - they couldn't be tied up when REAL guests needed them. The second compliment goes to the Banquets/Catering staff - WÖW! Fast, efficient and cooperative. I was fighting allergies and needed lots of fluids and they kept my ice water pitcher - at the exhibit table - filled with fresh water and ice both days. The food was very nicely served and the staff was sharp looking, obviously proud of their work and kept on the move all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel, near Camden Yards -- Get HIGH!”
Reviews.Author: jimdotcom
Reviews.Content: My wife booked us, THEN we looked at TripAdvisor reviews. GULP! It sounded like we were in for a noisy, unpleasant time, based on many reviews here. As a result, I was pro-active, and that may have helped create our enjoyable experience. I asked for a room on an upper floor (to avoid road noise, especially buses) and for a room in the South Tower (more recently remodeled). Our room and the service was fine; all 15-plus staff encounters were excellent. As others have noted, the lobby is elegant -- I'd expect that for $179 including taxes. We had one comfortable king bed in a medium-size, clean room on the 24th (of 27) floor. The window slid open wide, which I liked, but kind of scared my wife. The small flat-screen worked well and the bathroom, with only a shower, no tub, was spotless and well stocked. We loved the view of home plate at Camden Yards, six blocks away. If there were neighbors on the floor, we never heard them. Now to some minor minor gripes: no free breakfast or newspaper; no fan/vent in the bathroom; some traffic noise (sirens, busses), but not really bothersome; only one office-style chair, no lounge chair. My advice: ask for South Tower up high. Thanks to all Trip Advisors for the insight!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for great price!”
Reviews.Author: cansecret
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and I thought the room was great. We stayed in the South Tower and the room was clean and impressive I thought. One king bed (very comfy) and I liked the wall mounted tv. The bathroom only had a shower, but that was sufficient for us. The hotel itself was very classy. The steakhouse in the hotel is very expensive, ask prices first! Room service was prompt and food was very good. Front desk was polite and everything was above satisfactory. We shuttled back and forth (provided by the hotel) to Johns Hopkins and we left our car in the Hopkins parking garage because it was less expensive. We also got a Johns Hopkins discount rate. The elevators on the day we checked out were a little slow because of a conference in the hotel, but overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not up to Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: ChipNovaMac
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a visit with friends and some sightseeing. The room was compact in size, but not overly small. Was surprised that it had only a shower, no tub, but the shower was large in size. It was a smoking room, with burn marks on the rug. The room was generally clean, yet there was dirt showing on the vent in the bathroom. And the lampshades in the bathroom needed dusting. The bed was firm and comfortable. Disappointing that the hotel welcome packets were more like something from a mom and pop hotel. A simple folder with stapled pages. The room service menu was beat up and dirty. I know that hotels are trying to save energy by moving to fluorescent lighting. Yet the cold light from those lamps makes one feel that you are in a hospital room. There should at least be one standard bulb in a hotel room. The shining spot was the staff. The valet parking staff was welcoming and attentive, as was the front desk staff. The hotel is well located for most of anything that one wants to do in downtown Baltimore. And for those that like gyms, theirs is well equipped and very clean. Bonus is that it is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: bri11164
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Baltimore for the Pats vs Ravens game December 1 - December 4, 2007. Hotel was conveniently located 4 or so blocks from inner harbor. One block from the light rail which you can take right from the airport ( and we did) for $1.75/person. Light rail has a Camden Yards stop and M&T Bank stadium stop(ravens). Once the train arrived it was about a 20min ride then a 5 minute walk to hotel. The hotel has a Shula's steakhouse (fine dining) and a Shula's II sports bar. Check in took all of 10min and hotel was busy as Army/Navy game fans were everywhere. City itself was packed and did not clear out until late sunday. We were on 16th floor corner room. Not much of view as it faced inward not toward water, however we did not ask for harborside view. Room was of average size. King size bed, only one bureau for clothes and a chair. 30inch flat screen LCD TV with cable channels. Bathroom was very small. No tub only shower stall. Water was hot right away and water pressure was OK. Bed was comfortable. Furnishings seemed relatively new like hotel had been refurbished or something. Decent size closet with Iron/Ironing board. Room was quiet and clean all days of our stay. We did not eat at Shula's steakhouse but did spend sunday night at Shula's II watching the ESPN game that week. Word to the wise stay away from the Meatloaf sandwich. Did not agree with me and my system was a mess until 12pm the next day. Obviously some sort of food poising. My wife had no problem with her meal. Breakfast buffet in same restaurant in morning was done very well. Good selection $15/person although you can probably get free passes from front desk or from bartender (we did). Omlet/eggs made to order as well as pancackers, french toast, scrambled,sausage, bacon etc. Gym was typical size of hotel gym but all equipment looked new and was working with individual TV's for the aerobic equipment. Gym overlooked olympic size outdoor pool (which was obviously closed). all this is located on like the 6th or 7th floor. Nothing fancy but good clean, comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and Friendly Service - Clean Swanky Rooms”
Reviews.Author: emoverseas
Reviews.Content: From Check in to check out the hotel was great. Valet were welcoming and friendly - helpful with bags etc. Front desk staff shook both our hands and welcomed us on check in. Also told us about hotels amenities - nice touch. The room was small but perfect for business travel and downtown hotel. Very nice as has been renovated and clean - flat screen tv was awesome and plush comfy bed. Room service was ontime and correct when arrived and all around the service from all staff was great. I did notice a long line at check in but realised that there were plenty of front desk staff - it was just busy. Shulas steakhouse was great for happy hour - ideal for a nice quiet dinner or just drinks. We went to Vellagia's for dinner in little Italy and so did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: vr7911
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. It is recently renovated so make sure you ask for one of their renovated rooms. Lobby: nice and spacious. Room: Clean and very nice! It was small but that's typical of a hotel in a big city. The bed was huge and very comfortable. Service: The service was great - I called downstairs to see if there was a microwave available to heat up leftovers and they just brought me one up to my room! Then they called to check that I got it and it was working okay. Location: Walkable to the Inner Harbor area. Good area overall. Parking: Valet and self park available. Overall, I was very impressed. It is an older hotel but they did a nice job renovating so I felt like I was in a really nice hotel. We only paid $99 a night when other comparable hotels (Hyatts, etc) in the area were charging over $200! This is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Disaster with No Sleep”
Reviews.Author: CapitalFlyer
Reviews.Content: This past week I spent three nights at this hotel and to put it briefly, it was the worst hotel I've stayed in during my adult life. Most of the time I usually stay in Fairmonts, Marriotts, and Hyatts for both business and leisure travel because for one thing, I like their loyalty programs. After a while a person can begin to take certain things for granted by staying in the usual quality those three companies put forward in their properties, even though there are good things and bad things in any particular property. Stay in a hotel like this though and you'll be shocked back in to an appreciation for the better hotels in the world. The staff was nice and seemed to want to work very hard to be friendly and please the guests--and my room was very clean. However, what good does any of that do you if you can't sleep??!! My room was in what I now know is the infamous South Tower. The traffic noise from Baltimore Street below was crazy. It's a main city bus line street so starting at 5am, every 60 seconds there was a bus roaring by. It was horrible. Not even turning the clock radio to static could drown out the noise. It wouldn't get quiet on the street until 2am. That allows a guest three hours of sleep. There's a bed. You won't be sleeping in it much though. I can't warn people enough about the noise from outside. You will not sleep. This led me to think about the couple of other times I've stayed in loud hotels that prevented me from sleeping, the Hyatt Regency Miami's loud drawbridge and the Aruba Marriott's slamming doors at 7am and I must ask--what good is a hotel that you can't sleep in? As the buses roared by for three straight nights at this hotel, I once again had to ask that question but in this case, I decided to write a review about my experience to at least try to warn others of the street noise at this property. Ear plugs might help but it's such a deep noise that comes from the bus engines as they accelerate through the intersection below the tower that I don't think they would help--and then how do you hear the alarm clock in the morning if you've got to use ear plugs? The room itself was also very odd in the lighting. There were three light sources for the entire room. The bathroom light and two dim lamps on either side of the bed. No desk lamp. No overhead light by the door or closet. To look at clothing, I had to use the bathroom light. I have never stayed in such a darkly lit room. They need to buy those cheap round white lights that you can stick up and push to turn on like they advertise on TV and put one of those in each closet area. The elevators to the tower went out the morning I was checking out. I had to climb up the stairs to get to my room to finish getting my stuff and then climb down again. Other people were also forced to use the stairs. Later in the day when I was going to my car in the self-park garage, those elevators in the North Tower were out and I had to go down by stairs in to the garage. The garage was flooding due to rains and there was water streaming from overhead as well as ponding all over the place. Finally, the public areas of the hotel have a dated and tacky look to them. Think royal blue and bright white with bright red accents and you'll get the picture. I have never in all my life been so happy to get out of a hotel and come home to peace, quiet, and lights!! Downtown Baltimore is such a great place to stay and have fun in. It's full of hotel choices. Stay at another hotel other than this. Even with an ongoing renovation, without an entirely new set of buildings on the sight that have been built with soundproofing, it's beyond help and you should seek out another place where you've got a better chance of getting sleep in your bed and a better chance of seeing things in your room with lights.

Reviews.Title: “Played out”
Reviews.Author: AlexCallaghan
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed at the accuracy of the other reviews. This is a played-out, rather depressing business hotel with nicely renovated rooms (which, unfortunately, lack minibars), and poor plumbing. Even so, it's no bargain. The hotel does its best to extract every penny it can from its guests. (Valet parking, for example, costs $33.60 a night---and then you have to wait 15 minutes for your car to be retrieved.) The in-hoel restaurant, Shula's, is a decent place to have a beer (I didn't eat there), but it, too, is expensive. Uninviting neighborhood. Office canyons with burnt-out carry-outs. Reminded me of Detroit, but without the music.

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovation - Nice Rooms but Had Problems”
Reviews.Author: tri74
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the South Tower, which we had heard was under renovation. When we mentioned the renovation to the Front Office, we were given a complimentary pass for one of three choices: free pay-per-view movie, free drink, or free snack. After staying one night, we decided not take take any. The room was newly renovated with a nice view, new bathroom, and flat screen TV. However, our TV did not work properly. An engineer came to our room quickly, but the TV could not be fixed, so we had to change rooms. Our new room had a functioning TV, but we soon found other issues. The main light did not work, so when got back to our room at 11pm, we had to walk in the dark until we reached the bedside light. When we tried to go to sleep, the elevator was broken and an alarm sounded every minute until it was fixed an hour later. The staff had been apologetic for every issue. But for the price we paid, we were dissatified with our stay. The complimentary pass was not sufficient for our aggravations. The hotel was willing to listen to our complaints and did offer a one night's complimentary stay as compensation for our aggravation. The hotel staff was excellent, however, keep in mind that you might not have the perfect stay. The location was very close to the Inner Harbor as well as Camden Yards. The offer valet parking, but we preferred the parking garage across the street (less expensive, easier access).

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED!”
Reviews.Author: scoop-son
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with the past few posts. I don't know if the hotel is under renovation but even if that is the case the condition of my room was horrible. It was definitely lower 2 star. So until they get their renovations complete and the place has been reassessed they should be noted as such. Horrible location.
