On the corner several city blocks from one end of the harbor. Being you might want to walk the harbor you will have to drive there or you will be too worn to have a decent time once you get there. Room condition. Yuck! I doubt my sheets were clean and kept my clothes on and slept on top of the comforter. Air freshner was only sign of clean in room as well as no visual obvious dirt. Dingy carpet, dark brown dated furniture, no chairs at desk in room, chip in bathroom sink, stains in tub, dusty vents exposed in shower, patched ceiling in shower, rusted light fixture, store bought hair dryer that couldn't be mounted, stained ironing board, dial temperature control. Hotel Beautiful lobby. That's where it ends. North and South tower had dirt on the hallway carpet. North tower had cardboard in an elevator taped to the floor cause marble was being fixed. Our floor had the no handset for the hall phone. Parking stinks, garage had full sign though I think they just wanted folks to use the valet at $20/day. I parked on the street which in this neighborhood I literally prayed for my car not to get broken into and walked quickly to the hotel after parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not Absolutely Terrible But Not a Good Experience at all”
Reviews.Author: Jereth
Reviews.Content: *** Copy of the Email i sent to Starwood about my stay. Still waiting to hear back *** I just returned home from a stay at the center city Sheraton in baltimore from sept 8th through the 10th. I had a very poor experience at that hotel. I stayed in room 1835 in the south tower, which i realize is being renovated currently, but this still is no reason for our curtain rod to close them to be broken and off the track, and the towel rack on one side to be about to break off the wall, we were afraid to put anything on it. Also, on the 9th, the maid service only came to our room around 630pm. We were in the middle of getting ready to goto dinner so we did not ask them for service as we needed the room to get ready at the time, but this seems quite abit late for maid service. I also called down to the desk that evening for an extra pillow which never showed up, and for 2 forks, which got me transfered to one place, then another, then back to the 2nd, then finally someone picked up, and when they did they brought 2 knives, which they did promptly go and get 2 forks upon my pointing this out, in their credit. Finally, we had an appetizer and drinks one evening (I believe the 8th) in Shulas 2. After receiving our food and drinks, our waitress vanished for the next 30 minutes. after being finished and waiting 10 minutes for a check, i had to ask another wait staff member to get her so we could pay. Individually, none of these things are major, but when added together it made for a very unpleasant experience at that particular sheraton, especially compared to some other starwood properties i have stayed at *** reading some other reviews it could have been alot worse, but this is defenitely NOT a 3* property at all, i booked though hotwire, paid 300 bucks a night less then the going rate (manager must have forgot to hit the 2 since it went from 79 i paid to 279 the next day on hotwire) and i dont think it was a good deal at all.

Reviews.Title: “This is a real STINKY POOPIE hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Toolman123
Reviews.Content: You go here at your own risk. The place is filthy and the rooms are worn. There is a smell in the air and I think it is the smell of my money on fire.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t go here”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We were spending some time in Baltimore as we moved our son into his college apartment.. My sister and her husband were with us. I booked 2 king size bed non-smoking rooms at the Sheraton through Expedia. We have stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 times before. When we arrived at the hotel, we were given a card that said Pardon our Dust. Not a good way to start a visit. You list this hotel as a 3 star hotel, with pardon our dust as the greeter, you need to rethink this rating. We went up to our rooms. Ours was a pit, the furniture was broken, the room was dirty and outside our door was a construction site. Back to the desk we go. On the way down, I see my sister heading for the desk. Her room was even more upsetting, someone had defecated in the toilet and did not flush. Is that a room that was ready for guest? You are trying to push these rooms off on us and giving us a free drink is going to make it all better. They send my sister up to another room while I go looking for my confirmation information so I can call Expedia. Imagine her surprise when she opened the door to room 2 and found two large men there. Thank heavens her husband was with her. The men told her that she would not be staying in that room because there was no electricity. The hall was covered with electrical lines. Thank heavens the only thing that greeted them was two electricians. They could have been seriously hurt. Back to the desk they go. At this point, I am on the hotel phone with Expedia and they are trying to book us a room in another hotel. The problem there is we already paid to park at a city lot. We are offered 2 more rooms. These are double bed and smoking rooms. My sister has asthma. She can’t sleep in a smoking room, but still we try these rooms. The hall stinks and so do the rooms. Back to the desk. We now have 6 rooms. None of the equaled a 3 star hotel status. I finally put the man from Expedia on hold and tell the hotel manager that I am going to get my husband, who was in the only sanctuary he could find, the bar. We are now over an hour into this stay and we are still carrying our bags. I did not plan this trip to review this hotel; I was there to spend time with my son, husband, sister and brother in law. Lo and behold an hour and a half into our stay and like magic there are 2 rooms. Non- smoking with king beds in the area of the hotel that is not a construction site. Our room is quite nice and I was happy to be able to finally put down my bags. My sister’s room appeared nice also until she go in to take a shower and found a used washcloth. We were only asking for what we had paid. I am shocked and disgusted with this whole experience. It took us longer to get into a hotel room that it did to move my son into his apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the NORTH tower”
Reviews.Author: lolomojo
Reviews.Content: Aside from this hotel being located in Baltimore (yikes!) this hotel is just ok. Apparently the north tower was recently remodled and has more of a Sheraton feel but there is still no wireless internet, no bathtubs and the location doesn't feel safe at night. The south tower is run down and dirty - don't stay there. I thought the hotel staff service was pretty good though.

Reviews.Title: “One Slight Problem”
Reviews.Author: heathergutsche
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very nice once you got in. It is a little bit of a hike to the inner harbor. The place was nice except we had one problem. After we got home, I checked my Discover Card and there were a few charges on there that I didn't make. They weren't big amounts however I was charged for lunch at Shula's restaurant, then there was also another charge for something else. I called the hotel immediantly and apparently the next person who had our room was charging things to the room. The hotel never took off my credit card from the room. Luckily, Discover resolved this. I felt when I called the hotel to tell them I never ate at these restaurants they were slightly rude- especially since it was there mistake!

Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: blablablaNy
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel experience I have ever had. Not only did they conveniently "forget" about the agreed-upon rate of reservation upon check-in, but the rooms were NOT CLEANED when we went in--disgusting! To add to that, the staff sent to fix the room took their time arriving and were incredibly rude. The hotel didn't do anything to compensate for the mess that they left, and the rooms themselves were hardly anything special - small, cramped, and with few amenities. You'd think a hotel would have the customer in mind rather than the bottom line, but sadly this is not the case. I thought Sheratons were supposed to be quality, but it looks like the name doesn't carry the weight it used to. Would give no stars if I could -- AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: DonnaC60
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful weekend at The Sheraton Baltimore City Center Hotel in Baltimore Maryland. We have been to the Inner Harbor Area before to see a baseball game 2 years ago and said that this time we would like to stay at the Inner Harbor. After searching through many hotels and getting discouraged by the ridiculously high prices some of the hotels were asking I recieved an e-mail from the Sheraton and figured from their reputation that we couldn't go wrong. After reading some of the reviews I must say I was concerned that maybe this experience would be different. Everything was just fine and then some. Parking was nearby (across the street @ $18 per day) and convenient. Check-in was efficient. We requested 2 rooms in the North Tower that were ajoining which was honored. The room was more than adequate. It was new and clean with a nice flat screen T.V. and a nice view of the pool below. The location although not directly on the Inner Harbor was good and as long as you stick to the main roads for ultimate security there is no problem. Chambermaids and Bell staff were friendly and helpful and check-out was effortless. Our bill was under the door the morning of our departure with an additional memo concerning the high volume of check-outs to be expected that day because of the Ballgame and Jazz festival . An explanation of special provisions to be made for luggage storage of patrons checking out that would be attending the game that day were included. I was impressed to say the least. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, let's mention the NORTH Tower”
Reviews.Author: Pir8guy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week (Aug. 07). I was lucky enough to be in the North Tower. I have to say the room was very nice. Obviously, you get the comfortable bed. But my room was very attractive, with new furniture and a most excellent flat screen TV mounted on the wall! Shula's was closed for renovations, but the sports bar was open and the 2 lunch sandwiches I had there were great (and reasonable by downtown/big city prices). The lobby was always extremely crowded (we had at least one covention, and a huge family reunion). Do take note about the sketchy location. It's a 4 block walk to the convention center, and a good little walk to Inner Harbor. The surrounding area is hit and miss, and you do NOT want to make a wrong turn. I'd suggest a cab in the evenings, even short distances. in all, I believe once the South Tower gets renovated, this will be a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of improvement”
Reviews.Author: faither130
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is under going renovations. There are two towers a north and south. The north is is much better shape. Our 1st room in the south tower had no dresser, the frame for the closet was wallpapered over, the toilet seat was haning off and this was one of the rooms which was just redone. Friends had another south tower room and were never told that they would not have any water from 10am till 3 pm everyday during their stay. We were moved to the north tower and was much better. After many discussions with the manager we were given free breakfast buffet which was in Shula's resturant in the hotel. Breakfast was a lot to be desired. Want a huge breakfast, walk down the street to the Days Inn right across the street from the convention center. Shula's is estremely expensive and the service is very very slow. We waited 40 minutes just to get menus to our table. Only reason we stayed was to see how long it would actually take. Travelocity was contacted and stated that they were sending a team down to investigate. They never notified us that the hotel was undergoing renovations. The pool was just opened that day so the water was quite cold but we were thankful it was open.

Reviews.Title: “Is that blood on the door, or...?”
Reviews.Author: SDNews
Reviews.Content: NOTICE: This is an OK hotel, as long as your room is in the north tower!!! Stayed here with our biz group for a trade show in Balto, and got stuck in a badly worn room on the 19th floor of the dreaded south tower. Wallpaper in the bathroom was torn up, carpet was badly stained, there was something that resembled dried blood under the peephole on the door, as well as the back of the bathroom door (not to mention the long human hair that was painted into the back of the door). The tub & bathroom floor were dirty when I checked in, and never got any cleaner throughout my stay. I can deal with all of that, but the thing that really drove me nuts was the fact that the shower head was positioned at about neck-level (and I'm only 5-9) so I had to pull a modified Matrix move just to get my head wet. Not cool! The one good thing the room had going on was the bed. When Sheraton took over (the hotel was recently purchased by Sheraton; used to be a Wyndam), they moved their signature beds into all the rooms, so at least I slept well. The hotel staff were "Sheraton friendly" (if you've stayed at a few Sheratons, you know what I mean), and were helpful for the most part. I spoke with the GM for a few minutes one morning (he was down at the front door greeting people as they came through) and he was very cool. He explained that Sheraton had just recently taken over the hotel and they were working feverishly to get the rest of the hotel renovated. Needless to say, I had a few recommendations for him, so hopefully there will be a hot tub installed shortly. :>) There are 2 "Shula's" (as in Miami Dolphins Don Shula) reataurants on the lobby level. One is more of a casual sports bar type place, and the other is a fine-dining steakhouse. We ate at the former several times, and the food was consistently good, however the service was horrible and the prices were very high (cheeseburger & fries - $13.95). As is always my complaint with Sheraton's, they charge you 10 bucks a day for Internet access. This hotel has found even more ways to nickel & dime you, however, by charging you $10 to have a package delivered to you at the hotel. I ship boxes to hotels all over the country all the time, and this is the first time I've ever been charged for it. A bit rediculous in my opinion. And finally, a word of warning...Use caution when walking around the neighborhood outside this hotel at night. A few of our staff were coming back to the hotel around 10PM from the inner harbor, and just outside the hotel they ran across an guy who had been robbed & stabbed several times in the neck. Thankfully, all of our guys are firefighters with medic training, so they were able to help him out until the paramedics got there, but had they shown up 5 minutes sooner, it could have been them laying there bleeding. If you're going out at night, drive or take a cab!!! HELPFUL HINT: If you have a car in valet and need to leave, call down to the valet at least 15 minutes before you want to leave so they can get your car out. Otherwise, you'll be waiting a while.

Reviews.Title: “Why are you complaining?”
Reviews.Author: FMDtraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm about to write a good review, I promise I'm not some Starwood ghost writer. I stayed here in the North Tower for one night on business. Check in was easy. The lobby was clean and attractive. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and modern. I had a flat screen TV, huge king bed which was comfortable. The Shula's restaurant in the lobby had excellent food and was open until 11 PM. The location was decent and is walking distance to the innerharbor. There is a Starbucks one block away. The area seemed safe enough at all hours. The best part was their limo service. Without a wait, one of the bellmen took me to BWI in one of the Sheraton coach cars for $24, $10 less than what I paid for a taxi the night before. As far as business stays go, this definitely gets a top rating from me! For business, I'll definitely stay here again. If pleasure (and I don't know why anyone would go to Baltimore for pleasure) I would probably do the Sheraton Inner-Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Tourista16
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Sheraton City Center for a wedding. I had a great time. I was able to check in at 10:00 am with no problems. They had no problems with bringing my dog. I was able to walk her around the hotel with no problems. The room was very clean. The beds were VERY comfortable. Bathroom was clean. When I checked in they gave me a ticket for a care package to be sent up to my room because of the construction on my tower. The package was great. We ordered room service for dinner and breakfast and had no problems. Would definately stay here again and would recommend to others.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Baltimore City Center Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 101 West Fayette Street, Baltimore, MD 21201 (Formerly Wyndham Inner Harbor)
